1.name: Aberration Hunters' Amulet
1.image: Aberration Hunters' Amulet Icon.png
1.icon: Aberration Hunters' Amulet Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Aberration Hunters' Amulet is an uncommon Amulet that grants a Githyanki wearing it Advantage on Intelligence Saving Throws and aberrations have Disadvantage on attacks against them. The wielder can gain Advantage on Attack Rolls against Aberrations for 3 turns, once per Short Rest.
1.quote: Many a Githyanki hunter has worn this amulet before you. The strange stones set in swirling silver reverberate with echoes of their magic.

effects.name: Ancient Grudges
effects.description: Touch your amulet to subsume a sliver of the knowledge of the gith. You gain Advantage on Attack Rolls against aberrations.

1.name: Absolute Confidence Amulet
1.image: Amulet Necklace D Bronze A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace D Bronze A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Absolute Confidence Amulet is an uncommon Amulet that grants the wearer a +1 bonus to Performance checks at the cost of -1 to Intimidation checks.
1.quote: The interlocked bronze links of this necklace tinkle softly every time you move.

1.name: Absolute's Talisman
1.image: Absolute's Talisman Icon.png
1.icon: Absolute's Talisman Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Absolute's Talisman is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to cast a self-only version of Aid, and grants Advantage on Death Saving Throws if they bear the Absolute's Brand.
1.quote: Stained by blood, and gifted to only the most faithful of True Souls to help preserve their lives.

1.name: Amulet of Bhaal
1.image: Amulet of Bhaal Icon.png
1.icon: Amulet of Bhaal Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Amulet of Bhaal is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to inflict Bleeding when hitting targets with maximum hit points.
1.quote: A silver amulet depicting the symbol of Bhaal.

1.name: Amulet of Branding
1.icon: Amulet Necklace D Silver A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Amulet of Branding is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Brand the Weak once per Long Rest.
1.quote: Though thin and delicate-looking, the amulet's pendant sits heavy against your chest.

1.name: Amulet of Elemental Torment
1.image: Amulet Necklace B Bronze A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace B Bronze A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Amulet of Elemental Torment is an uncommon Amulet that channels the effects of certain Surfaces into the wearer's spells.
1.quote: Each jewel gleams with the energy of the natural elements.

1.name: Amulet of Greater Health
1.image: Amulet of Greater Health Icon.png
1.icon: Amulet of Greater Health Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Amulet of Greater Health is a very rare Amulet that can be obtained from the House of Hope.
1.quote: Worn by Lumi, a cleric beholden to twilight, who sheltered her fellow adventurers as a bantam shelters her chicks.

1.name: Amulet of Misty Step
1.image: Amulet Necklace B Silver A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace B Silver A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Amulet of Misty Step is an uncommon amulet that grants its wearer the Misty Step spell on a short rest cooldown.
1.quote: This necklace allows the wearer to cast Misty Step. Made of blue gems unique to a privately-owned mine in Menzoberranzan, this necklace was likely a token of esteem - or perhaps a desperate attempt to win its recipient's mercy.

1.name: Amulet of Restoration
1.image: Amulet Necklace F Silver A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace F Silver A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Amulet of Restoration is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Healing Word and Mass Healing Word once per Long Rest.
1.quote: The gemstone centrepiece of the amulet was long ago mottled and dyed by the tears of a martyr.

effects.name: Amulet of Restoration
effects.description:
Healing Word|level=1|recharge=Long Rest
Mass Healing Word|level=3|recharge=Long Rest

1.name: Amulet of Selûne's Chosen
1.image: Amulet Necklace E Pearl A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace E Pearl A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Amulet of Selûne's Chosen is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Selûne's Dream once per Long Rest.
1.quote: The gems and pearls of this necklace have a brilliant shine to them, as if reflecting unseen moonlight.

1.name: Amulet of Silvanus
1.image: Amulet Necklace D Bronze A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace D Bronze A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Amulet of Silvanus is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Lesser Restoration once per Short Rest.
1.quote: This amulet, engraved with a small waterfall, imparts a feeling of calm serenity when worn.

1.name: Amulet of Windrider
1.icon: Amulet Necklace D Gold A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Amulet of Windrider is a very rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Ride the Wind and Gust of Wind. It is one of the rewards of the quest Save Vanra.
1.quote: Heavily embossed with filigree, this necklace reflects light in all directions.

effects.name: Ride the Winds
effects.description: Cast as a level 3 spell (Long Rest).

1.name: Amulet of the Devout
1.image: Amulet of the devout.png
1.icon: Amulet of the devout Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Amulet of the Devout is a very rare Amulet that grants the wearer a +2 bonus to Spell Save DC and, if the wearer has access to it, an additional use of chadiv.
1.quote: Otto, a member of the powerful arcane organisation the Circle of Eight, had a penchant for amulets. So much so that they announced his arrival before he ever needed to.

1.name: Amulet of the Drunkard
1.image: Amulet Necklace A Silver A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace A Silver A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Amulet of the Drunkard is a rare amulet that causes the wearer to regain Healing|2d4 hit points once, during the first turn of Drunk that happened with this item equipped. It also increases the duration of Drunk to 5 turns.
1.quote: Donning this necklace causes the room to sway and tip - or maybe it was already swaying? Whatever, time for another pint.

1.name: Amulet of the Harpers
1.image: Amulet Necklace F Silver A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace F Silver A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Amulet of the Harpers is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Shield once per Long Rest and grants Advantage with Wisdom Saving Throws.
1.quote: Nobility can be found in suffering the slings and arrows of outrageous fortune. So can dying. Best to be on guard.

1.name: Amulet of the Unworthy
1.image: Keepsake Locket A Glowing Faded.webp
1.icon: Keepsake Locket A Glowing Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Amulet of the Unworthy is an uncommon Amulet that protects the wearer from Slashing damage, but leaves them vulnerable to Bludgeoning damage.
1.quote: Once part of the Girdle of Blades, this buckle was torn off and fashioned into an amulet that can be worn by creatures of all sizes.

effects.name: Amulet of the Unworthy
effects.description:
Resistance to Slashing damage
Vulnerability to Bludgeoning damage

1.name: Beastmaster's Chain
1.image: Amulet Necklace D Bronze A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace D Bronze A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Beastmaster's Chain is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Animal Friendship once per Long Rest.
1.quote: The green jewel set into this necklace's pendant is carved to resemble a cat's slivered pupil.

1.name: Bloody Amulet
1.image: Bloody Amulet Icon.png
1.icon: Bloody Amulet Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Bloody Amulet is an Amulet and a Story Item.
1.quote: Tiny specks of blood cover this amulet. They have pooled into the engravings on the back, spelling out the name 'Wulbren' in a grisly brown hue.

1.name: Brass Locket
1.image: Keepsake Locket A Faded.png
1.icon: Keepsake Locket A Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Brass Locket is an Amulet and a Story Item.
1.quote: Slightly tarnished, and opened with a mere flick of the thumb.

1.name: Broodmother's Revenge
1.image: Amulet Necklace F Bronze A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace F Bronze A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Broodmother's Revenge is an uncommon Amulet that coats the wearer's weapon in poison whenever they are healed.
1.quote: Each of this amulet's jewels shines like a viper's eyes.

1.name: Champion's Chain
1.image: Champions Chain Icon.png
1.icon: Champions Chain Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Champion's Chain is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to grant an ally a bonus to Intimidation.
1.quote: A plump mass torn from Sovereign Glut's own flesh. A marker of the colony's esteem - or perhaps its property.

effects.name: Tyrant Tongue
effects.description: Grant an ally a +2 bonus to Intimidations once per Long Rest.

1.name: Chancer's Carcanet
1.image: Amulet Necklace B Bronze A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace B Bronze A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Chancer's Carcanet is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to use a reaction to make an Attack Roll or SavingThrow with Advantage, once per Long Rest.
1.quote: Imbued with a little luck after the item was pressed to the pursed lips of a saint of the goddess Tymora. Inscribed roughly and inexpertly on the underside: 'Lady Luck, don't you piss in my porridge oats!'

1.name: Corvid Token
1.image: Amulet Necklace F Bronze A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace F Bronze A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Corvid Token is a very rare Amulet that increases jump distance and flying speed, grants the Polymorph: Dire Raven action, and grants Feather Fall to the wearer, which persists while Polymorphed or Wild Shaped.
1.quote: 'Let your lips turn black as night/On this eve of frightful wights/Let your throat be filled with screams/Nearby looms the Raven Queen!' - A song of dark festivity

effects.name: Polymorph: Dire Raven
effects.description: Take the shape of a dire raven that can avoid attention and Blind enemies. It has 13|Healing.

1.name: Envoy's Amulet
1.image: Envoys Amulet Icon.png
1.icon: Envoys Amulet Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Envoy's Amulet is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to grant an ally a bonus to Persuasion.
1.quote: A fleshy amulet shaped by Sovereign Spaw's own hand. Wherever the bearer goes, so does the myconid circle.

effects.name: Voice of the Circle
effects.description: Grant an ally a +2 bonus to Persuasions, once per Long Rest.

1.name: Fey Semblance Amulet
1.image: Amulet Necklace C Gold A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace C Gold A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Fey Semblance Amulet is a very rare Amulet that gives the user advantage on all mental saving throws.
1.quote: Originally the kidney stone of an archfey, this object has been, ahem, passed down through the centuries.

1.name: Fireheart
1.image: Amulet Necklace F Gold A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace F Gold A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Fireheart is an uncommon Amulet that grants the wearer 2 turns of Heat when they take Fire|Fire damage.
1.quote: The ruby's red reflections look like eerie flames dancing across your skin.

1.name: Frost Prince
1.image: Amulet Necklace B Silver A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace B Silver A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Frost Prince is an uncommon Amulet that grants the wearer the ability to cast the Ice Knife spell.
1.quote: Each sapphire feels like a tiny shard of sharpened ice.

1.name: Hammergrim Mist Amulet
1.image: Amulet Necklace A Gold A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace A Gold A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Hammergrim Mist Amulet is an uncommon Amulet that grants the wearer the ability to cast the Fog Cloud spell.
1.quote: One of the relics of Deep Duerra's rebellious children. Drugging the Keykeeper of Duerra's vaults, the children crept in under cover of night and plundered their mother's treasure - searching desperately for anything that would aid in their flight.

1.name: Khalid's Gift
1.image: Amulet Necklace A Bronze A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace A Bronze A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Khalid's Gift is a very rare Amulet that was gifted to Jaheira by Khalid and stored away in the basement of her home. While wearing it, Jaheira cannot be cursed.
1.quote: A gift from Khalid for Jaheira.

effects.name: Khalid's Gift
effects.description:
Wisdom +1 (up to 21)
Khalid's Gift: Aid|level=3|recharge=Long Rest

1.name: Kill collar
1.image: Dog_Collar A Faded.png
1.icon: Dog Collar A Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Kill Collar is an uncommon Amulet that represents the collars used by Gortash to keep the Gondians within the Iron Foundry in check.
1.quote: Smells a bit rusty, but looks stylish nonetheless.

1.name: Komira's Locket
1.image: Keepsake Locket A Glowing Faded.webp
1.icon: Keepsake Locket A Glowing Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Komira's Locket is an uncommon Amulet that grants the wearer the ability to cast the Dancing Lights cantrip.
1.quote: Worked carefully into the locket's metal back are the words, 'Never dark again.'

1.name: Mayrina's Locket
1.image: Mayrinas Locket Icon.png
1.icon: Mayrinas Locket Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Mayrina's Locket is an Amulet and a Story Item.
1.quote: An aged, blue-stained scrap of paper within this locket reads: 'To Mayrina - Will you go to the summer fair with me? From Connor. PS. These bluebells are from Ma Grundy's patch, please don't tell!'

1.name: Moondrop Pendant
1.image: Moondrop Pendant Icon.png
1.icon: Moondrop Pendant Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Moondrop Pendant is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to avoid provoking Attacks of Opportunity when below 50% hit points.
1.quote: The back bears an inscription under a delicate crescent moon. 'You're a novice no more, Robin. Only right you should carry a little of our Lady's light with you.'

1.name: Necklace of Elemental Augmentation
1.image: Amulet Necklace F Gold A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace F Gold A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Necklace of Elemental Augmentation is an uncommon Amulet that adds the Spellcasting Modifier to the damage when the wearer uses elemental damage with a cantrip.
1.quote: The tourmaline in this necklace is almost uncomfortably hot, warmed by a heat all its own.

1.name: Pearl of Power Amulet
1.image: Pearl of Power Amulet Icon.png
1.icon: Pearl of Power Amulet Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Pearl of Power Amulet is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wielder to restore a spell slot of 3rd level or lower once per Long Rest.
1.quote: There are no molluscs of power, alas.

effects.name: Pearlescent Restoration
effects.description: Restores a single Spell Slot of 3rd level or lower.

1.name: Periapt of Wound Closure
1.image: Periapt of Wound Closure Icon.png
1.icon: Periapt of Wound Closure Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Periapt of Wound Closure is a rare Amulet that automatically stabilizes a downed user at the start of their turn and maximizes the amount of hit points restored when healing.
1.quote: Sometimes the best thing you can do for your friends is to stop bleeding and give them a chance to sort everything out.

1.name: Psychic Spark
1.image: Amulet Necklace B Silver A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace B Silver A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Psychic Spark is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to cast a stronger version of Magic Missile.
1.quote: Every gem hanging from this necklace is warm to the touch, as if waiting to ignite.

1.name: Sentient Amulet (Rare)
1.image: Sentient Amulet Icon.png
1.icon: Sentient Amulet Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Sentient Amulet is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Shatter once per Short Rest (with a drawback) and Ki Restoration (Lesser) once per Long Rest.
1.quote: Sun-graced warmth radiates from both the pendant and its chain. Somehow, even a brief glance of it brings a smile to your face.

effects.name: Talk to the Sentient Amulet
effects.description: As a free action, the wearer can start a conversation with the amulet.

effects.name: Ki Restoration (Lesser)
effects.description: Using the spiritual energy in the amulet, you restore 2 Ki Points (Long Rest).

effects.name: High Spirits
effects.description: The amulet's spirit lingers, making everything seem a little more vibrant. Must succeed a Wisdom Saving Throw (DC 10/15, see notes) when using the amulet's power, or become Hysterical (equivalent in effect to Tasha's Hideous Laughter with a duration of 1 turn).

1.name: Sentient Amulet (Very Rare)
1.image: Sentient Amulet Icon.png
1.icon: Sentient Amulet Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Sentient Amulet is a very rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Shatter once per Long Rest and Ki Restoration (Greater) once per Long Rest. It is a possible reward for the quest Help the Cursed Monk.
1.quote: Sun-graced warmth radiates from both the pendant and its chain. Somehow, even a brief glance of it brings a smile to your face.

effects.name: Ki Restoration (Greater)
effects.description: Can cast once per Long Rest.

1.name: Shar's Temptation
1.image: Amulet Necklace E Pearl C Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace E Pearl C Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Shar's Temptation is an Amulet that allows its wearer to cast Charm Person once per Short Rest.
1.quote: The inlaid jewels are so rich in colour, so deep in hue, you could lose yourself in them.

1.name: Silver Pendant
1.image: Silver Pendant Icon.png
1.icon: Silver Pendant Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Silver Pendant is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Guidance.
1.quote: Grime covers this necklace, but you can vaguely discern delicate engravings of a moon and harp.

effects.name: Guidance
effects.description: You gain the ability to cast the Guidance cantrip.

1.name: Spell Savant Amulet
1.image: Amulet Necklace B Gold A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace B Gold A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Spell Savant Amulet is a rare Amulet that grants an additional Level 2 spell slot.
1.quote: When on the wrong side of a few sherries, the powerful wizards Bigby and Tenser would sometimes see how many spells they could fit into amulets like this one before they burst.

1.name: Spellcrux Amulet
1.image: Amulet Necklace D Bronze A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace D Bronze A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Spellcrux Amulet is a very rare Amulet that allows the wearer to restore any one spell slot once per Long Rest.
1.quote: Some scholars have speculated that spells have a mind of their own, suggesting that the spells get bored between being cast and restored.

effects.name: Spell Slot Restoration
effects.description: Replenish an expended spell slot of any level as a Bonus once per Long Rest.

1.name: Spineshudder Amulet
1.image: Amulet Necklace C Silver A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace C Silver A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Spineshudder Amulet is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to inflict Reverberation when dealing damage with ranged spell attacks.
1.quote: Quivers creep up your enemy's back - the slow, long-fingered hand of your magic.

1.name: Strange Tendril Amulet
1.image: Amulet Necklace B Gold A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace B Gold A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Strange Tendril Amulet is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Evard's Black Tentacles once per Long Rest.
1.quote: Eldritch sigils seem to coarse through the metalwork on this amulet.

1.name: Surgeon's Subjugation Amulet
1.image: Amulet Necklace A Silver A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace A Silver A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Surgeon's Subjugation Amulet is a rare Amulet that, once per Long Rest, paralyses a humanoid on a Critical Hit.
1.quote: A surgeon is only as reliable as her tools. And, indeed, as depraved.

effects.name: Paralysing Critical
effects.description: When scoring a Critical Hit on a humanoid, the wearer can Paralyse the target for 2 turns (Long Rest).

1.name: Tarnished Charm
1.image: Tarnished Charm Icon.png
1.icon: Tarnished Charm Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Tarnished Charm is an uncommon amulet that reduces the DC of the wearer's death saving throws.
1.quote: A menacing cackle emanates from this twisted charm. It whispers to bite, to maim, to kill...

1.name: The Amulet of Lost Voices
1.image: Amulet of Lost Voices Icon.png
1.icon: Amulet of Lost Voices Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Amulet of Lost Voices is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Speak with Dead once per Long Rest.
1.quote: The dead hold no secrets from Jergal's Scriveners of Doom.

1.name: The Blast Pendant
1.image: The Blast Pendant Icon.png
1.icon: The Blast Pendant Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Blast Pendant is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to focus and discharge their Lightning Charges to strengthen their next lightning spell.
1.quote: Though they only worked together for a short time, it is hard to overstate the influence Lenore the cleric of Mystra had on Yrre the Sparkstruck, who often likened harnessing lightning to manipulating the Weave.

effects.name: Lightning Blast
effects.description: Once per Long Rest you may focus the electricity in your veins as a bonus action. Your next lightning spell or cantrip deals additional Lightning|Lightning damage equal to your remaining Lightning Charges. On a hit, all of your Lightning Charges are consumed.

1.name: The Ever-Seeing Eye
1.image: The Ever-Seeing Eye Icon.png
1.icon: The Ever-Seeing Eye Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Ever-Seeing Eye is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Protection from Evil and Good once per Short Rest.
1.quote: A pale green eye, pierced by the twisting branches of a dead tree - the result of a foolhardy woman begging Auntie for a favour.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Protection from Evil and Good|level=1|recharge=Short Rest

effects.name: The Ever-Seeing Eye
effects.description: Protection from Evil and Good|level=1|recharge=Short Rest

1.name: The Spectator Eyes
1.image: Amulet Necklace A Bronze A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace A Bronze A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Spectator Eyes is a very rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Ray of Fear and Wounding Ray once per Long Rest.
1.quote: Spectators are hideous aberrations that float above the ground, fiercely staring around and shooting beams at anything they don't appreciate.

effects.name: The Spectator Eyes
effects.description:
Ray of Fear|level=3|recharge=Long Rest
Wounding Ray|level=3|recharge=Long Rest

1.name: Tressym Collar
1.image: Amulet Necklace A Bronze A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace A Bronze A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Tressym Collar is a very rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Telekinesis once per Long Rest.
1.quote: The gem in this collar's centre is placed as a common courtesy: it allows the tressym's summoner to be identified and complained to in the case of bereaved pet owners or pigeon-masters. This one glows with a Waterdhavian name: Gale Dekarios.

1.name: Uncovered Mysteries
1.image: Amulet Necklace B Silver A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace B Silver A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Uncovered Mysteries is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Detect Thoughts once per Long Rest.
1.quote: Beneath the layers of dust covering this necklace, its inlaid gems still give off a blue sparkle - the colour of Mystra's clergy.

1.name: Unflinching Protector Amulet
1.image: Keepsake Locket A Faded.png
1.icon: Keepsake Locket A Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Unflinching Protector Amulet is a very rare Amulet that can be obtained from Ptaris.
1.quote: Touching this amulet's centrepiece, you are imbued with a vision of woven strands, and the strands coming apart and holding true and firm over your friends, like shields banded in a haze of golden light.

2.name: Acrobat Shoes
2.description: Acrobat Shoes is a pair of rare Boots that grants a bonus to Acrobatics and Advantage on Dexterity Saving Throws.
2.quote: These flexible shoes were once owned by Audreyne Willoughs, who, in a somewhat ironic twist of fate, ran away from the circus to join her parents back home.

effects.name: Acrobat Shoes
effects.description:
Acrobatics +1
Advantage on Dexterity Saving Throws.

2.name: Blackguard's Greaves
2.description: Blackguard's Greaves are a rare pair of Greaves that grant their wearer a permanent Longstrider effect and a +1 bonus to Athletics.
2.quote: Clad on the desiccated feet of a death knight, these boots have walked a long and terrible path. They strode through the tattered remains of their owner's oath. With every heavy footstep, they have sounded pure fear into the hearts of men.

2.name: Bonespike Boots
2.description: Bonespike Boots are a Very rare pair of Boots that enhances jump distance and gives the character access to the Brutal Leap ability.
2.quote: Armour designed for the aerodynamic leaping and striking and general screaming of your standard barbarian.

effects.name: Brutal Leap
effects.description: Leap at a target and possibly knock it Prone.

2.name: Boots of Aid and Comfort
2.image: Boots of Aid and Comfort Icon.png
2.icon: Boots of Aid and Comfort Unfaded Icon.png
2.description: Boots of Aid and Comfort are an uncommon pair of Boots that grant additional Temporary Hit Points to creatures healed by the wearer.
2.quote: Sturdy and well-worn, these boots make a snug fit on any wearer.

2.name: Boots of Apparent Death
2.description: Boots of Apparent Death are a rare set of Boots that grants the wearer the ability to cast Feign Death once per Short Rest.
2.quote: Practical jokes with these boots often involve all your stuff being stolen by opportunistic cousins.

2.name: Boots of Arcane Bolstering
2.icon: Boots of Arcane Bolstering Unfaded Icon.png
2.description: Boots of Arcane Bolstering is a pair of rare Boots that grants Arcane Charge each time the wearer Dashes, adding +1 bonus to damage with spells while Threatened.
2.quote: Fizzling barbs of enchantment magic crackle from the laces of these boots.

2.name: Boots of Brilliance
2.description: Boots of Brilliance are a rare pair of Boots that allow the wearer to replenish one Bardic Inspiration charge once per long rest.
2.quote: Tiny bells are sewn into the boots' cuffs. They jingle subtly with every step.

effects.name: Restore Bardic Inspiration
effects.description: Play your instrument to restore one of your Bardic Inspiration slots (Long Rest).

2.name: Boots of Elemental Momentum
2.icon: Boots of Elemental Momentum Unfaded Icon.png
2.description: The Boots of Elemental Momentum are an uncommon pair of Boots that grant Momentum whenever the wearer deals elemental damage with a spell or cantrip.
2.quote: Toughened metal boots, highly insulated with heavy leather and padding for use in any and all elements.

2.name: Boots of Genial Striding
2.icon: Boots of Genial Striding Unfaded Icon.png
2.description: Boots of Genial Striding is a pair of rare Boots that allow the wearer to move over difficult terrain without impediment.
2.quote: The soles of these boots warp and shift like warm clay manipulated by an unseen sculptor's hands.

2.name: Boots of Persistence
2.description: Boots of Persistence is a pair of Boots that grant their wearer permanent Freedom of Movement and Longstrider effects.
2.quote: 'If I had a copper for all the adventurin folk I seen gutted or cut up, or clawed like they was made of wet paper, just cause they couldn't move quick enough when speed might have saved em... well, I'd be suckin good brandy from crystal rather than this fuckin swill.' - Overheard in a tavern in Baldur's Gate.

2.name: Boots of Psionic Movement
2.image: Boots Metal Githyanki B Magic Faded.png
2.icon: Boots Metal Githyanki B Magic Unfaded Icon.png
2.description: Boots of Psionic Movement are a very rare pair of Boots that allow Githyanki wearers to fly, and enhances their attacks with Psychic|Psychic damage.
2.quote: When not atop their dragons, gith are not particularly air-worthy. This is probably for the best. The imposition of downward gravity tends to put most people in a mood.

effects.name: Boots of Psionic Movement
effects.description:
Dexterity Saving Throws +1
Githborn: Flying Boots|level=3|recharge=Long Rest

2.name: Boots of Speed
2.description: The Boots of Speed is a pair of rare Boots that allows the wearer to click their heels for a burst of speed that makes it difficult for enemies to land Attacks of Opportunity on them.
2.quote: Featherlaced and flexible of sole, these boots have been used to round up - and outrun - many a foe.

effects.name: Click Heels
effects.description: Click the heels of your boots as a bonus to gain Click Heels for 1.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: This condition doubles your Movement Speed and inflicts Disadvantage on Opportunity Attacks against you.

effects.name: Boots of Speed
effects.description: This condition doubles your Movement Speed and inflicts Disadvantage on Opportunity Attacks against you.

2.name: Boots of Stormy Clamour
2.icon: Boots of Stormy Clamour Unfaded Icon.png
2.description: Boots of Stormy Clamour are an uncommon pair of Boots that inflicts the Reverberation condition on a creature when afflicting it with another condition.
2.quote: Peals of thunder rumble at the back of your skull with every step taken in these boots.

2.name: Boots of Striding
2.description: The Boots of Striding are an uncommon pair of Boots that grants the wearer a burst of speed whenever they begin concentrating on a spell.
2.quote: The metal of these greaves is comfortably warm against your shins, as though heated by your mere presence.

2.name: Boots of Uninhibited Kushigo
2.icon: Boots of Uninhibited Kushigo Unfaded Icon.png
2.description: The Boots of Uninhibited Kushigo are a rare pair of Boots that add your Wisdom modifier to your unarmed strikes' damage.
2.quote: During a hilltop battle that soaked the slopes in gore, Kushigo's best friend Irishi was scalped before he could help her.  The enemy held up the bloody wig, and Kushigo fell upon one, and then another, until he had killed so many that they hung from his antlered shoulders like skewered effigies.

2.name: Boots of Very Fast Blinking
2.description: Boots of Very Fast Blinking are an uncommon pair of Boots that grant the wearer the ability to cast Misty Step once per turn, but with the drawback that their clothes are left behind.
2.quote: You can cast Misty Step, with the caveat that you will teleport leaving your clothes behind.

2.name: Cinder Shoes
2.description: Cinder Shoes is a pair of uncommon Boots that grants Heat whenever the wearer Burns an enemy.
2.quote: Despite the many scorch marks, these leather boots are somehow still supple and intact.

2.name: Dark Justiciar Boots
2.description: The Dark Justiciar Boots are a rare pair of Boots that grants the wearer better Dexterity Saving Throws and the ability to cast Shadow Teleportation once per Short Rest.
2.quote: Scratched in places, scorched in others, and worn thin at the heel, these boots bear the indelible marks of experience.

effects.name: Shadow Teleportation
effects.description: Teleport to an unoccupied, obscured spot (Short Rest).

2.name: Disintegrating Night Walkers
2.description: The Disintegrating Night Walkers are a pair of very rare Boots that grants their wearer immunity to various surface effects, and also allows them to cast Misty Step once per Short Rest.
2.quote: Darker than a starless night, Night Walkers are made for secrecy in the honour of Shar. This particular pair was found deep in the ruins of an Underdark fortress. Though the leather is old and the magic is fading, the boots were recently cleaned and oiled with care.

2.name: Evasive Shoes
2.description: The Evasive Shoes are a rare pair of Boots that give a small bonus to Acrobatics and Armour Class.
2.quote: Rogues in Waterdeep prefer these spring-loaded boots that make evading the city watch a breeze.

2.name: Helldusk Boots
2.description: The Helldusk Boots are a very rare pair of Boots that allows the wearer to ignore Difficult Terrain, and to use a reaction to succeed on a Saving Throw. It also grants the Hellcrawler bonus action.
2.quote: No ore takes better to being forged than the infernal iron of Avernus, where the archdevil Zariel presides.

effects.name: Hellcrawler
effects.description: Teleport to an area and deal 2d8|Fire damage where you land. The impact blast spreads in a 3m / 10ft zone.

2.name: Hoarfrost Boots
2.description: Hoarfrost Boots are an uncommon pair of Boots that allow the wearer to not slip on icy surfaces.
2.quote: A smattering of tiny ice crystals have formed cleats on the soles of these hardy boots.

2.name: Linebreaker Boots
2.description: The Linebreaker Boots are a rare pair of Boots that grants the wearer Wrath whenever they Dash.
2.quote: Lightweight fur and leather, designed to speed the wearer's charge into battle.

2.name: Mystra's Grace
2.description: Mystra's Grace is an uncommon pair of Boots that allow the wearer to cast the Feather Fall spell at will.
2.quote: Wearing these boots is like walking on cotton clouds.

2.name: Slinging Shoes
2.description: Slinging Shoes is a pair of Boots that deal psychic damage and return to the wearer when thrown.
2.quote: These shoes were formerly enchanted to return to their owner's feet. This caused a great deal of trouble for owners, who, while wearing a slipper or a nice heeled number, kept being kicked in the ankles by jealous footwear.

2.name: Spaceshunt Boots
2.description: Spaceshunt Boots is a rare pair of Boots that allow the wearer to cast the Dimension Door spell as an Action once per Long Rest.
2.quote: These boots are well-maintained and clean, though their soles are thin from wear.

2.name: Spiderstep Boots
2.description: Spiderstep Boots are an uncommon pair of Boots that allow the wearer to walk across webs freely.
2.quote: Slightly sticky to the touch, these boots have an excellent grip.

2.name: Springstep Boots
2.description: Springstep Boots is a pair of rare Boots that allows the wearer to gain Momentum whenever they dash in combat, further improving their Movement Speed.
2.quote: Supple leather rebounds with every step, as if urging the wearer on.

2.name: Swiresy Shoes
2.description: The Swiresy Shoes are a pair of rare Boots that improve Jumping distance and Acrobatics skill.
2.quote: Likely fashioned in tribute to the extremely small, high-vaulting rascal who pillaged many a hen house - Lupperdiddle Swires.

2.name: The Speedy Lightfeet
2.description: The Speedy Lightfeet are a pair of rare Boots that allow the wearer to gain Lightning Charges when Dashing in combat.
2.quote: It is said The Speedy Lightfeet were the first of many lightning inventions made by Yrre the Sparkstruck. The boots' old, frayed edges zap and crackle with even the slightest movement.

2.name: The Watersparkers
2.description: The Watersparkers are a pair of rare Boots that allow the wearer to electrify water surfaces and gain Lightning Charges.
2.quote: An enormous storm was raging the first time Yrre the Sparkstruck left the Underdark. The deep gnome's interest in lightning became at once an all-consuming obsession, and they would spend the rest of their years striving to recreate that storm's power themselves.

2.name: Tyrannical Jackboots
2.description: Tyrannical Jackboots are an uncommon pair of Boots that grant a +1 bonus to Charisma checks and Saving Throws.
2.quote: Each step taken in Gortash's shoes is a reflection of the man himself: quick, sharp, and terrible.

2.name: Unwanted Masterwork Greaves
2.description: Unwanted Masterwork Greaves are a rare pair of Boots that provide a bonus to Athletics. It is part of the Unwanted set.
2.quote: These boots are stamped with the marks of a cancelled commission. Despite their discarded fate, they still hum with complex infernal arcana.

2.name: Varsh Ko'kuu's Boots
2.description: Varsh Ko'kuu's Boots are an uncommon pair of Boots that grant immunity to Acid surfaces and Resistance to Acid|Acid damage.
2.quote: Though the leather is slick with acid, the corrosive liquid doesn't seem to damage the boots - nor does it penetrate.

2.name: Vital Conduit Boots
2.icon: Boots Metal Githyanki Magic Unfaded Icon.png
2.description: The Vital Conduit Boots are a pair of rare Boots that grants the wearer temporary Hit Points when they cast a Spell that requires Concentration.
2.quote: Tenser's notes on arcane displacement were not only read by wizards - other avid readers included enterprising smiths eager to break into the magic items market.

3.name: Cindermoth Cloak
3.description: Cindermoth Cloak is an uncommon Cloak that inflicts Burning on any foe within 2m / 7ft that damages the wearer.
3.quote: With every rustle of this cloak, small moths like windblown embers appear around you - they flutter for a moment, then fade into inconsequence.

3.name: Cloak of Cunning Brume
3.icon: Cloak of Cunning Brume Unfaded Icon.png
3.description: Cloak of Cunning Brume is an uncommon Cloak that grants the user a smokescreen cloud effect when trying to Disengage.
3.quote: One of the relics of Deep Duerra's rebellious children. The children found nothing of use in the vault and were discouraged. But in the morning the Vault Keykeeper's son, who admired the children, sought them out - and in his arms he brought a wealth of things, forged in shadow.

3.name: Cloak of Displacement
3.description: Cloak of Displacement is a rare Cloak that, every turn, subjects enemy attacks against its wearer to Disadvantage until the wearer takes damage.
3.quote: The fur is so blue as to be almost black. When mantled across your shoulders, the patterns on the cloak seem to shift and ripple.

3.name: Cloak of Elemental Absorption
3.icon: Cloak of Elemental Absorption Unfaded Icon.png
3.description: Cloak of Elemental Absorbtion is an uncommon Cloak that allows the wearer to absorb a small amount of magical damage, and add it to their next attack.
3.quote: A favourite among fleet-footed gish, this cloak allows the wearer to wield a foe's elemental mastery against them.

effects.name: Absorb Elements
effects.description: Absorb elemental damage once per Short Rest. Take half damage from the next elemental attack targeting you, and deal an additional d6|Piercing 1d6 of that element type on your next attack.

3.name: Cloak of Protection
3.description: Cloak of Protection is an uncommon Cloak that grants the user +1 Armour Class and +1 to SavingThrows
3.quote:
Wizards Otiluke and Bigby may be renowned as dignified members of the Circle of Eight, but on one occasion, as younger men, Bigby bet Otiluke that he couldn't suck thirteen litres of vodka out of a protection cloak like this one.

Bigby won.

3.name: Cloak of the Weave
3.icon: Cloak of the Weave Unfaded Icon.png
3.description: Cloak of the Weave is a very rare Cloak that allows the wearer to absorb a small amount of magical damage, and add it to their next attack. It also gives better Spell Save DC and Spell Attack Rolls.
3.quote: Part of an outfit worn by the wizard Tenser when he was inducted into the organization of eminent wizards called the Circle of Eight.

effects.name: Absorb Elements
effects.description: Absorb elemental damage once per Short Rest. Take half damage from the next elemental attack targeting you, and deal an additional d6|Piercing 1d6 of that element type on your next attack.

3.name: Derivation Cloak
3.description: Derivation Cloak is a rare Cloak that heals the wearer for 1d4 Hit Points when they Poison a foe.
3.quote: Based on a mad alchemist's experiments to derive youth from his victims by poisoning them, this cloak relies on a much more reliable arcane formula.

3.name: Fleshmelter Cloak
3.description: Fleshmelter Cloak is an uncommon Cloak that deals acid damage to creatures that deal melee damage to the wearer.
3.quote: Droplets of foul acid drip from the tails of this cloak, as if from the stinger of a demonic scorpion.

3.name: Mantle of the Holy Warrior
3.image: Mantle of the Holy Warrior Faded.png
3.icon: Mantle of the Holy Warrior Unfaded Icon.png
3.description: The Mantle of the Holy Warrior is a Very Rare Cloak that grants the wearer the ability to cast Crusader's Mantle.
3.quote: This garment accidentally fell into the communal steambaths during the All Saints Morning Retreat And Candlelit Guided Meditation.

3.name: Nymph Cloak
3.description: Nymph Cloak is a very rare Cloak that allows the wearer to cast Dominate Person once per Long Rest.
3.quote: The charmers, seducers, philanderers, flirts, gallants, beguilers, ravishers, rogues, tempters, and tantalisers of the Feywild all share one common trait: they make you feel as if you are the only diamond among the drift.

3.name: Reverse Rain Cloak
3.description: Reverse Rain Cloak is an uncommon Cloak that grants the user the condition wet while worn, increasing resistance to Fire, but granting vulnerability to Lightning and Cold damage.
3.quote: The wearer is perpetually just a little bit damp.

3.name: Shade-Slayer Cloak
3.description: Shade-Slayer Cloak is a very rare Cloak that reduces the number you need to roll a Critical Hit while hiding.
3.quote: Rough and coarse, the cloak's materials soften to silk when immersed in shadow.

3.name: The Deathstalker Mantle
3.description: The Deathstalker Mantle is a rare Cloak that turns the wearer Invisible for 2 turns after killing an enemy.
3.quote: Let hill and hollow be a doorTo screams that last forevermore

3.name: Thunderskin Cloak
3.description: Thunderskin Cloak is an uncommon Cloak that has a chance to Daze creatures with the Reverberation condition when they damage the wearer.
3.quote: Through a gap in the long snarls of thread, you are sure you can glimpse a great black thunderhead swollen with purple lightning and spears of rain.

3.name: Vivacious Cloak
3.description: Vivacious Cloak is an uncommon Cloak that grants the wearer 8 temporary Hit Points when casting a spell in melee.
3.quote: The sheer mortal terror of the low-vitality spellcaster (who can be blown over by a wafted spoon) can be partially offset by cloaks like this one.

3.name: Wavemother's Cloak
3.description: Wavemother's Cloak is a rare Cloak that grants its wearer Water Layer Protection every turn.
3.quote: Little jellyfish-shaped pockets line the inside of this cloak.

4.name: Armour of Uninhibited Kushigo
4.icon: Armour of Uninhibited Kushigo Unfaded Icon.png
4.description: The Armour of Uninhibited Kushigo is an uncommon piece of Clothing that allows the wearer to counter attack an enemy that misses them, so long as Patient Defence is active.
4.quote: Long ago, Kushigo was a warrior. Bedecked in an enormous set of plate steel, its shoulder pauldrons fashioned like great antlered stags, his arrival on a battlefield spelled doom for the enemy.Yet this armour - so light and fine - speaks nothing to that legacy.

4.name: Barbarian Clothes
4.description: Barbarian Clothes are a common piece of Clothing.
4.quote: A rough combination of furs, leathers, and supple fabrics, made for a life outside civilisation.

4.name: Bided Time
4.description: Bided Time is a set of uncommon Clothing that causes the wearer to gain Arcane Charge whenever they are hit by a melee attack.
4.quote: Revenge is best served. Hot or cold makes no difference.

4.name: Bloodguzzler Garb
4.description: The Bloodguzzler Garb is an uncommon piece of Clothing that grants its wearer Wrath when an enemy damages the wearer.
4.quote: "No sooner does blood speck the armour than it's absorbed, as if sustaining something within."

4.name: Bonespike Garb
4.description: Bonespike Garb is a very rare Clothing that grants temporary hit points when using Rage, and reduces incoming damage by 2. Attackers receive Piercing|Piercing damage when the wearer is struck.
4.quote: Sharp juts and knobbly nodules of bone stud this armour, as if something ancient sank its teeth deep into the leather and they got stuck there.

4.name: Cloth Armour
4.description: Cloth Armour is an uncommon piece of Clothing that grants Wrath when an enemy damages the wearer.
4.quote: No sooner does blood speck the armour than it's absorbed, as if sustaining something within.

4.name: Cloth of Authority
4.description: Cloth of Authority is a rare piece of Clothing that grants immunity to emotion-altering conditions and grants +1 Armour Class and Advantage on Intimidation and Insight checks.
4.quote: One can hardly be called a lord if they aren't dressed as such. A cursory glance at Gortash's finery would reveal intricate garb - a closer look would reveal a maddening attention to even the most minute details of the filigree.

4.name: Clothes
4.description: Clothes are a common piece of Clothing that provide no benefit to the character wearing them.

4.name: Drunken Cloth
4.description: Drunken Cloth is a rare piece of Clothing that grants the wearer Advantage on Constitution Saving Throws while Drunk. They also gain temporary hit points at the start of each turn.
4.quote: Long ago, Kushigo was a warrior. Bedecked in enormous, stag-antlered plate, his arrival spelled doom for the enemy. This flimsy cloth speaks nothing to that legacy.

4.name: Enraging Heart Garb
4.description: The Enraging Heart Garb is a rare piece of Clothing that grants Wrath while the wearer is Raging. It also increases Constitution by 2.
4.quote: Created by a designer and an enchanter who were going through a messy divorce at the time. As such the armour is filled with passive-aggresive rage.

4.name: Garb of the Land and Sky
4.image: Garb of the Land and Sky Icon.png
4.icon: Garb of the Land and Sky Unfaded Icon.png
4.description: Garb of the Land and Sky is rare Clothing that grants the wearer Blade Ward when using Patient Defence. When using Step of the Wind, the wearer's next Attack Roll has Advantage and deals an additional Force|1d8 Force damage.
4.quote: Long ago, Kushigo was a warrior. Bedecked in an enormous set of plate steel, its shoulder pauldrons fashioned like great antlered stags, his arrival on a battlefield spelled doom for the enemy.Yet this armour - so light and fine - speaks nothing to the legacy.

effects.name: Garb of the Land and Sky

4.name: Icebite Robe
4.description: Icebite Robe is a rare piece of Clothing that grants the wearer Resistance to Cold|Cold damage and allows them to cast Armour of Agathys as a 3rd level spell once per Long Rest.
4.quote: Delicate ferns of frost glitter in the lining of this robe.

effects.name: Icebite Robe
effects.description:
Resistance to Cold damage.
Armour of Agathys|level=3|recharge=Long Rest

4.name: Infernal Robe
4.description: Infernal Robe is a very rare piece of Clothing that makes its wearer resistant to Fire|Fire damage and grants the Fire Shield (Warm) at level 4, once per Long Rest.
4.quote: Presumably Mizora was not always a sensuous and manipulative benefactor of troubled souls like Wyll. Negotiating the hierarchies of hell result in changes of form - but was she ever less beautiful, less erudite, less willful?

effects.name: Infernal Robe
effects.description:
Fire Shield: Warm|level=4|recharge=Long Rest|action type=Bonus
Grants Resistance to Fire damage.
Armour Class +1

4.name: Monastic Robes
4.description: Monastic Robes are a common piece of Clothing.
4.quote: This garment's pristine condition despite years of martial training speaks to a supremely disciplined owner.

4.name: Moon Devotion Robe
4.description: Moon Devotion Robe is a very rare Clothing that grants Advantage on Constitution Saving Throws and grants the ability to cast Produce Flame and Lunar Bulwark.
4.quote: A memory from her childhood: a warm bed. Through the cracked window, she could see the moonlight cupping the plums in the tree as if in silver hands. The name of the goddess Selûne came to her, and never left.

effects.name: Lunar Bulwark
effects.description: Can cast as a level 1 spell (Long Rest).

effects.name: Moon Devotion Robe
effects.description:
Advantage on Constitution Saving Throws.
Saving Throws +1
Produce Flame|level=0

4.name: Mutilated Carapace
4.description: Mutilated Carapace is a rare piece of Clothing that grants its wearer a bonus to Attack Rolls and damage rolls while being disguised, as well as Advantage on Deception and Persuasion Ability Checks.
4.quote: Hard, fleshy leather has been derived from a countless slew of victims to form this armour for Bhaal's fetid chosen.

4.name: Obsidian Laced Robe
4.description: Obsidian Laced Robe is rare piece of Clothing that deals Fire|Fire damage to enemies on a successful Saving Throw against their spells, and grants its wearer resistance to Fire|Fire damage.
4.quote: The inside of this robe is dark and faceted like volcanic glass, yet the material is light and soft. Against the skin, it also produces a heat like a toasty fire on a day of snow.

4.name: Poisoner's Robe
4.description: The Poisoner's Robe is an uncommon piece of Clothing that makes the wearer's poison spells deal more damage.
4.quote: Found in the Spider Queen's stomach, this robe emanates a sour smell and stings to the touch.

4.name: Potent Robe
4.description: The Potent Robe is a very rare piece of Clothing that uses your Charisma modifier to increase your cantrips' damage as well as give you temporary hit points.
4.quote: This robe is a difficult look to pull off unless one is blessed with an otherwordly charisma.

4.name: Robe
4.description: A Robe is a common piece of Clothing.
4.quote: Crafted with care, this robe will protect you from the elements. It won't do much against a sword's thrust, though.

4.name: Robe of Exquisite Focus
4.icon: Robe of Exquisite Focus Unfaded Icon.png
4.description: The Robe of Exquisite Focus is a rare piece of Clothing that increases its wearer's Spell Save DC.
4.quote: This robe once belonged to one of the great wizard Tenser's lecturers. While in university, Tenser used to practise spells on this robe, sometimes resulting in wonderful arcane discovery.

4.name: Robe of Summer
4.description: The Robe of Summer is an uncommon piece of Clothing that grants the wearer Resistance to Cold|Cold damage.
4.quote: This robe's thin fabric is pleasantly warm to the touch.

4.name: Robe of Supreme Defences
4.icon: Robe of Supreme Defences Unfaded Icon.png
4.description: The Robe of Supreme Defences is a very rare Clothing that adds your Spellcasting Modifier to your Saving Throws, when you are concentrating on a spell.
4.quote: Long ago, the young wizard Bigby noticed his friend Tenser spending a lot of time with his robe. One of nature's pranksters, Bigby sent his dog, Bigboy, to savage the garment. The ensuing struggle between canine and nude wizard was brutal, and eventually led to Tenser designing more durable robes like this one.

4.name: Robe of the Weave
4.icon: Robe of the Weave Unfaded Icon.png
4.description: Robe of the Weave is a very rare Clothing that allows the wearer to heal when succeeding a saving throw against a spell, and boosts Spell Save DC and Spell Attack by 1 each.
4.quote: Earnest little Edith Cluckle was a small girl when she asked to be the great wizard Otiluke's apprentice. He scoffed at her, but was quickly abashed when Mystra herself endowed Edith with this very cloak.

4.name: Shelter of Athkatla
4.description: Shelter of Athkatla is a rare Clothing that grants the wearer Advantage against spell Saving Throws, and grants the ability to cast Mirror Image
4.quote: Mantled in the sublime majesty of this cloak, you magically sense Lorroakan's complex feelings for his homeland. Merriment and comfort go hand in hand with a jilted sentiment around his lovers and his family. And the old friends he thought of, but would never see again.

4.name: Sorcerer Robe
4.description: The Sorcerer Robe is a common piece of Clothing and the starting armour for a Wild Magic Sorcerer.
4.quote: Neat leather bands keep the trailing cloth secure. Singed sleeves are a liability for any spellcaster.

4.name: The Graceful Cloth
4.description: The Graceful Cloth is a rare piece of Clothing that gives its wearer +2 Dexterity and the Cat's Grace condition. It also boosts the wearer's Dexterity Saving Throws and jump distance.
4.quote: A garment worn by one of three monks who fought together against Headless Serpent, Secret Venom, a gang in the port city of Nyanzaru. This was worn by Roahton Mobar, whose stances were broad and strong.

4.name: The Mighty Cloth
4.description: The Mighty Cloth is a rare piece of Clothing that gives its wearer +2 Strength (up to 20) and the Bull's Strength condition. Also grants the wearer the Bull Rush class action.
4.quote: A garment worn by one of three monks who fought together against Headless Serpent, Secret Venom, a gang in the port city of Nyanzaru. This was worn by Kimigha Poji, whose stances were narrow and swift.

effects.name: Bull Rush
effects.description: Charge forward and possibly knock your foes back m=3|ft=10.

4.name: The Protecty Sparkswall
4.description: The Protecty Sparkswall is an rare Clothing that increases the wearer's defences while they have Lightning Charges and grants a +1 bonus to their Spell Save DC.
4.quote: Yrre the Sparkstruck was raised in the Underdark, so they weren't surprised that power begets envy, and envy begets violence. They were prepared.

4.name: Veil of the Morning
4.icon: Veil of the Morning Unfaded Icon.png
4.description: Veil of the Morning is a very rare Clothing that imposes Disadvantage on Undead Attack Rolls against the wearer, grants the wearer Advantage against Undead spells and actions, and allows the wearer to Turn Undead.
4.quote: Crafted from celestial feathers, bottled sunlight, and ink from the pages of sacred scripture, it's a wonder the maker didn't hang cloves of garlic from this robe, so anathema is it to the undead.

effects.name: Turn Undead
effects.description: Cast as a Class Action (Long Rest).

4.name: Vest of Soul Rejuvenation
4.icon: Vest of Soul Rejuvenation Unfaded Icon.png
4.description: Vest of Soul Rejuvenation is a very rare Clothing that allows the wearer to heal on a successful saving throw against a spell, and can make an Unarmed Attack against any attacker that misses, using a Reaction.
4.quote: A garment worn by one of three monks who fought together against Headless Serpent, Secret Venom, a gang in the port city of Nyanzaru. This was worn by Strigga Morkoscavich, whose stances moved fluidly, flawlessly, and who defanged the Serpent one blustery night.

4.name: Viconia's Priestess Robe
4.description: Viconia's Priestess Robe is a rare Clothing that grants the wearer Advantage on Stealth checks while Obscured, and enhances Shield of Faith to give a +2 to all Saving Throws as well.
4.quote: Listening to the magical hum this robe emits dulls your senses, thoughts, feelings - everything. Listen too long, and you can almost hear the screaming chitters of a thousand spiders devoured by encroaching, hungry darkness. Almost.

4.name: Wavemother's Robe
4.description: Wavemother's Robe is a very rare Clothing that grants the wearer Resistance to Fire|Fire and Cold|Cold damage. The wearer also heals while standing in water and can cast Create or Destroy Water.
4.quote: Tales tell of a most wondrous fish, scales resplendent, an intricate jewel that shone beneath the sea. When it died, the Wavemother gifted its hide as a robe to her most devoted follower - and demanded she drown the sailors that killed her gem-bright fish.

effects.name: Wavemother's Robe
effects.description:
Create or Destroy Water|level=4|recharge=Long Rest
Armour Class +1.

5.name: Abyss Beckoners
5.description: The Abyss Beckoners are a very rare pair of gloves that improve the damage resistance of summons at the risk of driving them Mad.
5.quote: Demons will bite their masters, slaves, comrades, and, on occasion, themselves. They bite on principle, and are functionally piranha with extra steps.

5.name: Bhaalist Gloves
5.description: Bhaalist Gloves are a very rare pair of Gloves that allow the wearer to Garrotte a target.
5.quote: When the Lord of Murder, Bhaal, was rendered mortal, he knew his days were numbered. His vile machinations had gained him many enemies. Those days ran out and Bhaal was indeed killed, not by a god, but by a man with hawkish features named Cyric.

effects.name: Garrotte
effects.description: Wrap a shadow rope around a Humanoid creature's throat to deal 1d10|Bludgeoning damage and start Garrotting it (STR saving throw to avoid becoming Garrotted for 3) Short Rest.

5.name: Blackguard's Gauntlets
5.icon: Gloves of Metal E Unfaded Icon.png
5.description: Blackguard's Gauntlets are a rare pair of Gauntlets that grant their wearer +1 Attack, +1 Strength Saving Throws, and allows them to cast Inflict Wounds as a 4th level spell once per Long Rest.
5.quote: For some paladins, the iron-clad grip that an oath holds can be too much to bear. When these champions fail and falter, their hands that would guide turn cold, hard, and piercing.

effects.name: Blackguard's Gauntlets
effects.description:
Inflict Wounds|level=4|recharge=Long Rest
Strength Saving Throws +1
Attack rolls +1

5.name: Bonespike Gloves
5.icon: Gloves Barbarian Magic B Unfaded Icon.png
5.description: Bonespike Gloves is a pair of very rare gloves that make your attacks ignore Resistance to Slashing, Piercing, and Bludgeoning damage.
5.quote: These gloves were soaked in the marrow of a Dragon Turtle, its bones broken and their fluid drained in sloppy chunks into vats.

5.name: Bracers of Defence
5.description: Bracers of Defence are a rare pair of Gloves that increase the wearer's Armour Class by 2 when unarmoured and not holding a shield.
5.quote: Delicate twists of magical iron - painstakingly gilded - have been fashioned into these fortifying vambraces.

5.name: Braindrain Gloves
5.description: Braindrain Gloves are an uncommon pair of Gloves that inflicts Mental Fatigue on a foe whenever the wearer deals Psychic|Psychic damage to them.
5.quote: Somewhere deep in the spongy grey matter and little jiggly bits that comprise the brain, the memory of the slimy tadpole slithering over your eyeball lingers...

5.name: Cerebral Citadel Gloves
5.description: The Cerebral Citadel Gloves are rare gloves that provide a bonus to Attack Rolls and Saving Throws when a character Charms or Frightens a creature.
5.quote: The taut violet leather is drier than snakeskin, and puckered at each knuckle with shallow mouth-shaped pits.

5.name: Cindersnap Gloves
5.description: Cindersnap Gloves are a rare pair of Gloves that grants the spell Protection from Missiles.
5.quote: 'What moves faster, a loosed crossbow bolt or a windblown cinder? Let's find out.' - Overheard during a Flaming Fist raid in Baldur's Gate.

5.name: Craterflesh Gloves
5.description: Craterflesh Gloves are a rare pair of Gloves that deal additional Force|Force damage on a Critical Hit.
5.quote: Indents on the fingertips of these gloves are ringed with tiny meteorites, lined in a shimmering purple light rather than the rich red of astral flame.

5.name: Daredevil Gloves
5.description: Daredevil Gloves are a rare pair of Gloves that enhance Spell Attack Rolls and enable casting spells without Disadvantage even when adjacent to an enemy.
5.quote: The sting of fear at the encroachment of some hulking brute is lessened by these gloves. In fact, in such moments, they send rivulets of courage coursing through you.

5.name: Dark Displacement Gloves
5.description: Dark Displacement Gloves are a rare pair of Gloves that grant their wearer a +1 Attack Roll bonus when attacking with thrown items. They can swap positions with the target if they fail a Dexterity Saving Throw. They also grant +1 Sleight of Hand.
5.quote: Rudimentary teleportation sigils mark the palms of these gloves, like coiled snakes in a bath of pitch.

5.name: Dark Justiciar Gauntlets (Rare)
5.description: The Dark Justiciar Gauntlets are a rare pair of Gloves that cause weapon attacks to deal an additional Necrotic|1d4 Necrotic damage. It also grants better Strength Saving Throws and allows the wearer to cast Beckoning Darkness once per turn.
5.quote: The grip of darkness is a fear felt by many. The grip of a Dark Justiciar's Gauntlets is a sacred fear reserved for an unfortunate few.

5.name: Dark Justiciar Gauntlets (Uncommon)
5.description: The Dark Justiciar Gauntlets are an uncommon pair of Gloves that cause weapon attacks to deal an additional Necrotic|1d4 Necrotic damage.
5.quote: The grip of darkness is a fear felt by many. The grip of a Dark Justiciar's Gauntlets is a sacred fear reserved for an unfortunate few.

5.name: Flawed Helldusk Gloves
5.description: Flawed Helldusk Gloves are a rare pair of gloves that grant Fire|1d4 Fire damage to weapon attacks. Unarmed attacks deal an additional Necrotic|1d4 Necrotic damage and have a chance to inflict Bleeding.
5.quote: 'Beneath those horrible sounds of... well, let's call it what it was: torment, Beneath the tormented screams I heard this moaning sound like many people in pain, and I heard the ringing of a great hammer. Carixim's forge was close.' - Overheard from the smith Dammon

5.name: Fleetfingers
5.description: The Fleetfingers are an uncommon pair of Gloves that allow the wearer to Jump after using Dash without costing a bonus action.
5.quote: Plain leather with a faint but unmistakable buzz - as if eager to put idle hands to work.

5.name: Gauntlet of the Tyrant
5.icon: Gauntlet of the Tyrant Unfaded Icon.png
5.description: Gauntlet of the Tyrant is a very rare Glove that grants +1 Spell Save DC and additional Force|Force damage for unarmed attacks. Also grants the Command spell.
5.quote: A tyrant's grip must be one of cool, unforgiving, and intricately realised steel. It cannot budge, cannot falter, no matter the pressure, and its fingertips must deeply pierce those who would struggle against it.

5.name: Gauntlets of Hill Giant Strength
5.image: Gauntlets of Hill Giant Strength Icon.png
5.icon: Gauntlets of Hill Giant Strength Unfaded Icon.png
5.description: Gauntlets of Hill Giant Strength are very rare Gloves that can be obtained from the House of Hope. These gloves set the wearer's Strength ability score to 23.
5.quote: Your basic hill giant is just a landslide with a digestive system.

5.name: Gauntlets of Surging Accuracy
5.description: Gauntlets of Surging Accuracy are a rare pair of gloves that give the wearer a +1d4 bonus to Attack Rolls for the rest of their turn when using Action Surge.
5.quote: Made from steel hammered thin, these gauntlets are a fine investment for any warrior.

5.name: Gauntlets of the Warmaster
5.icon: Gloves of Metal E Unfaded Icon.png
5.description: Gauntlets of the Warmaster are a very rare pair of Gauntlets that grant their wielder +1 on Attack Rolls and subject the targets of their Manoeuvres to Disadvantage.
5.quote: Clothing doesn't tend to have much personality. That comes down to how it's worn. Yet these gloves exude a confidence, an intangible aura of expertise.

5.name: Gemini Gloves
5.description: The Gemini Gloves are a very rare pair of Gloves that grants the wearer the to ability to cast Cantrip that can target foes or allies twice.
5.quote: Designed by an arcane smith with half-vision. He made these gloves to make sure his spells hit their target.

5.name: Gloves of Archery
5.description: Gloves of Archery are an uncommon Gloves that grants the wearer Proficiency with Longbows and Shortbows, as well as +2 damage with ranged weapon attacks.
5.quote: Banded in dark iron, these gloves are embossed with the brass likeness of an elf against a trio of arrows in flight.

5.name: Gloves of Baneful Striking
5.description: The Gloves of Baneful Striking are an uncommon pair of gloves that applies a penalty to its saving throws against the wearer's spells.
5.quote: The slightest movement of leather makes a dark energy seep out of the gloves.

5.name: Gloves of Battlemage's Power
5.description: Gloves of Battlemage's Power is a set of rare Gloves that allows the wearer to gain Arcane Acuity whenever their Weapon Attack Roll inflicts a condition.
5.quote: Bands of blue light snap and contract when the gloved fingertips are pressed together - evidence of the arcane polarity linking them.

5.name: Gloves of Belligerent Skies
5.icon: Gloves of Belligerent Skies Unfaded Icon.png
5.description: The Gloves of Belligerent Skies are an uncommon pair of Gloves that inflict Reverberation when the wearer deals Thunder|Thunder, Lightning|Lightning or Radiant|Radiant damage.
5.quote: Balling your fingers into fists while wearing these gloves causes a sonorous chime, like the fusion of a tempest and a church bell, to resound inside your skull.

5.name: Gloves of Cinder and Sizzle
5.image: Gloves of Cinder and Sizzle Icon.png
5.icon: Gloves of Cinder and Sizzle Unfaded Icon.png
5.description: The Gloves of Cinder and Sizzle are a rare pair of Gloves that give the wearer Fire|Fire damage to their unarmed attacks and the ability to cast Scorching Ray once per Long Rest.
5.quote: It was through scrying and observing blazing elementals that the monks of Plumgully Temple mastered the art of fighting fire with fists, and vice versa.

5.name: Gloves of Crushing
5.description: Gloves of Crushing are rare gloves that enhance unarmed attack rolls and grant bonus Physical|Bludgeoning damage to unarmed attacks.
5.quote: Stitched into the fabric of these gloves are the words: Largest and Largesse, For The Discerning Murderer.

5.name: Gloves of Dexterity
5.description: The Gloves of Dexterity are a very rare pair of gloves that give a character 18 Dexterity and increase their Attack Rolls by 1.
5.quote: The point at which the gloves meet the wrist is form-fitting and very snug; almost a hint at the supple quickness and skill these gloves permit the wearer.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Set the wearer's Dexterity score to 18. The enchantment has no effect if their Dexterity score is higher without it.

effects.name: Gloves of Dexterity
effects.description:
Set the wearer's Dexterity score to 18. The enchantment has no effect if their Dexterity score is higher without it.
Attack rolls +1

5.name: Gloves of Hail of Thorns
5.description: Gloves of Hail of Thorns are an uncommon pair of Gloves that grants the wearer the to ability to cast Hail of Thorns.
5.quote: Grants wearer ability to cast Hail of Thorns. Whoever previously owned these gloves marked each with a series of thirty superficial scrapes, six per finger. What they indicate is unclear.

5.name: Gloves of Heroism
5.description: The Gloves of Heroism are an uncommon pair of gloves that grants you Heroism whenever you use your Channel Oath spells.
5.quote: Suede covers the palms of these gloves — ensuring a soft, comforting touch for anyone in need of help.

5.name: Gloves of Missile Snaring
5.icon: Gloves of Missile Snaring Unfaded Icon.png
5.description: Gloves of Missile Snaring is a rare pair of gloves that allows the wearer to use Missile Snaring to reduce incoming ranged damage as a Reaction.
5.quote: These gloves seem to meld to your skin - supple, snug and dextrous as one could hope for.

5.name: Gloves of Power
5.description: Gloves of Power are an uncommon pair of Gloves that allows the wearer to inflict Bane on weapon attacks.
5.quote: Blessed by Priestess Gut, these gauntlets provide additional aid to any who bear the Absolute's mark upon their flesh.

5.name: Gloves of Soul Catching
5.icon: Gloves of Soul Catching Unfaded Icon.png
5.description: The Gloves of Soul Catching are a legendary pair of Gloves that grants additional Force|Force damage to unarmed attacks and heals the wearer after an unarmed attack. Also grants +2 Constitution.
5.quote: Formerly worn by Autumnal Baskin, a professional meditator turned bare-knuckle champion, who gained enlightenment via two methods. The second was getting a lot of fighting acumen. Advanced cosmic harmony is a nose. Sometimes you've got to break it a few times to get the best of things.

5.name: Gloves of The Duellist
5.description: Gloves of The Duellist are a rare pair of Gloves that enhance melee weapon Attack Rolls when the wearer only holds one weapon in the main hand.
5.quote: Ways of beginning a duel have varied over the years. Perhaps the most famous is the Bildumbacher Method, in which the instigator drips paint thinner onto the opponent's socks.

5.name: Gloves of Thievery
5.description: Gloves of Thievery are an uncommon pair of Gloves that give the wearer Advantage on Sleight of Hand checks.
5.quote: Useful for bank vaults, locked chests, and bolted barns.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Advantage on Sleight of Hand Checks.

effects.name: Gloves of Thievery
effects.description: Advantage on Sleight of Hand Checks.

5.name: Gloves of Uninhibited Kushigo
5.image: Gloves of Cinder and Sizzle Icon.png
5.icon: Gloves of Cinder and Sizzle Unfaded Icon.png
5.description: Gloves of Uninhibited Kushigo is a rare pair of gloves that deals additional damage with Throw attacks and Improvised Weapons attacks.
5.quote: Forsaking his infamous armour, Kushigo left Irishi's body and wandered naked, without thought or care, into the barren countryside. The land was flat and desolate under the red-gold sun, but compared to his lonely heart, it seemed alive with joy.

5.name: Gloves of the Automaton
5.description: The Gloves of the Automaton are a rare pair of Gloves that grant when activated, make a creature treated as a Construct and they gain Advantage on weapon attacks for 10 turns.
5.quote: Llena the Many-Times-Married would use these gloves to blend in with the statues in her courtyard. This would allow her to avoid her plethora of husbands. Anything for a moment's peace.

effects.name: Circuitry Interface
effects.description: You are considered a construct. Your weapon Attack rolls have Advantage, and you have resistance to Lightning damage.

5.name: Gloves of the Balanced Hands
5.description: Gloves of the Balanced Hands are a rare pair of Gloves that adds your Ability Modifier to the damage when you make an attack with your off-hand weapon.
5.quote: Formerly worn by Doubleway Douglas Fairbanks, who was so ambidextrous his tears ran down the back of his neck.

5.name: Gloves of the Growling Underdog
5.icon: Gloves of Metal E Unfaded Icon.png
5.description: The Gloves of the Growling Underdog are an uncommon pair of Gloves that grant its wearer Advantage on their melee attack rolls while surrounded by 2 or more enemies.
5.quote: Crowded taprooms. Packed feast halls. Bustling market bazaars. Chances to be social? Sure. Chances to be violent? Absolutely.

5.name: Helldusk Gloves
5.description: Helldusk Gloves are a very rare pair of Gloves that grant bonuses to spellcasting, weapon attacks, and unarmed attacks.
5.quote: What precisely confers eternal punishment, reward, absolution? Perhaps it's not just belief in a god. Perhaps the deciding factor is whether the gods believe in you.

effects.name: Helldusk Gloves
effects.description:
str saving throws +1
Rays of Fire (Cantrip)|level=0|recharge=Short rest

5.name: Hellrider's Pride
5.description: The Hellrider's Pride are an uncommon pair of Gloves that grant a creature resistance to the physical damage of weapon attacks when healed by the wearer of these gauntlets.
5.quote: A waft of sulphur emanates from these proudly-kept gauntlets.

5.name: Herbalist's Gloves
5.description: The Herbalist's Gloves are an uncommon pair of gloves that cleanse poison from those the wearer heals.
5.quote: The leather smells faintly of herbs, as if washed in a herbal bath.

5.name: Hr'a'cknir Bracers
5.description: Hr'a'cknir Bracers is a very rare set of Gloves that allows the wearer to cast Mage Hand as a Bonus Action and cast Telekinesis once per Short Rest.
5.quote: The planar silver cladding of these forearm bracers allows the wielder to channel the latent astral energies floating in the Weave.

effects.name: Quickened Mage Hand
effects.description: You can cast Mage Hand as a Bonus.

5.name: Ichorous Gloves
5.description: Ichorous Gloves are an uncommon set of Gloves that can inflict Noxious Fumes on targets that are dealt Acid|Acid damage.
5.quote: These gloves smell like beef mince left to rot in a privy pail.

5.name: Jhannyl's Gloves
5.description: Jhannyl's Gloves are a rare pair of Gloves that lets the wearer automatically cast Lesser Restoration on themselves when they become Blinded, Paralysed or Poisoned.
5.quote: Divine runes accentuate the finger pads. While not a religious sect, the Harpers do not demand the occlusion of religion in their members.

5.name: Knock Knuckle Gloves
5.description: Knock Knuckle Gloves are uncommon Gloves that grant the spell Knock and increases Sleight of Hand by 1.
5.quote: In the palm of the left glove is a glossy scarlet solution that coats Thieves' Tools, making them more reliable. In the right, arcane symbols wax and wane.

5.name: Legacy of the Masters
5.description: The Legacy of the Masters are a very rare pair of Gloves that grants the wearer +2 to Attack Rolls and Damage Rolls.
5.quote: Formerly the property of the royalty of Threskel, these gauntlets impart some of the prince of Threskel's legendary skill with weapons.

5.name: Luminous Gloves
5.description: The Luminous Gloves are an uncommon pair of Gloves that causes the wearer's Radiant|Radiant damage to afflict struck foes with the Radiating Orb condition.
5.quote: The pads of each fingertip shine from the fabric with a garish glow.

5.name: Martial Exertion Gloves
5.description: Martial Exertion Gloves are a rare pair of Gloves that allows the wearer to gain an additional attack and double its movement speed for one turn at the cost of taking some damage.
5.quote: 'You drop and give me thirty you sumbitch; you think a bugbear's gonna roll over and let you rub his tummy? One two three four - keep going maggot! Stronger, better, tougher!' - Any Sword Coast Drill Sergeant, Invariably

effects.name: Martial Exertion
effects.description: Push past your physical limits, taking 6d6|Piercing damage to gain an additional attack per turn and to double your movement speed Short Rest.

5.name: Nimblefinger Gloves
5.description: Nimblefinger Gloves are a rare pair of Gloves that grant a Dexterity bonus to Gnomes, Halflings, and Dwarves, and a bonus to Sleight of Hand.
5.quote: For the right wearer, these supple doeskin gloves offer both comfort and protection - alongside a perfectly attuned sense of where one's fingers are, and what pocket they're picking.

5.name: Poisoner's Gloves
5.description: Poisoner's Gloves are a rare set of Gloves that has a chance to poison a target every time it's dealt Poison|Poison damage.
5.quote: While the leather is clean and well-maintained, a cold, acrid smell permeates these gloves.

5.name: Quickspell Gloves
5.description: Quickspell Gloves are a pair of Very Rare Gloves that grant the wearer the ability to cast a Cantrip as a Bonus Action instead of an Action, once per Short Rest.
5.quote: These gloves were worn by the wizard Bucknard, who always maintained that speed was most important in spellcasting. This, because even if you royally bugger up the spell, you've got enough time to leg it away afterward.

5.name: Raven Gloves
5.description: Raven Gloves are rare Gloves that allow the wearer to summon a Raven.
5.quote: Dark and suitably moody, these gloves are perfect for wearing while thinking about poetry.

5.name: Reason's Grasp
5.description: Reason's Grasp are an uncommon pair of Gloves that give the wearer Temporary Hit Points if they choose to end their Rage.
5.quote: The snug fit of these gloves resist a balled fist - as if favouring the open hand of peace.

5.name: Seraphic Pugilist Gloves
5.description: Seraphic Pugilist Gloves are a rare pair of gloves that give additional 1d4 Radiant|Radiant damage to unarmed attacks and give the ability to cast Guiding Bolt.
5.quote: Apparently this is what happens to your handwear when you clock an angel in the chops.

5.name: Servitor of the Black Hand Gloves
5.image: Gloves of Cinder and Sizzle Icon.png
5.icon: Gloves of Cinder and Sizzle Unfaded Icon.png
5.description: The Servitor of the Black Hand Gloves are a rare pair of Gloves that give additional Force|Force damage to unarmed attacks and allows the wearer to cast Fear once per Long Rest.
5.quote: Covetous of Mystra's command of the Weave, Bane the Black Hand extends his grasp, each finger comprised of ten thousand fanatics, adjuncts of his evil will.

effects.name: Servitor of the Black Hand Gloves

5.name: Snow-Dusted Monastery Gloves
5.image: Gloves of Cinder and Sizzle Icon.png
5.icon: Gloves of Cinder and Sizzle Unfaded Icon.png
5.description: Snow-Dusted Monastery Gloves are a rare pair of Gloves that cause the wearer's unarmed attacks to deal an additional Cold|1d4 Cold damage. It also grants the ability to cast Ice Knife as a 3rd level spell once per Long Rest.
5.quote: Cracking your knuckles in these gloves dislodges puffy drifts of snow from your fingers.

5.name: Spellmight Gloves
5.description: Spellmight Gloves are a pair of very rare Gloves that allow the wearer to deal additional damage at the cost of accuracy.
5.quote: Designed for the jobbing spellcaster, these gloves are well-insulated to prevent digit immolation for the somatically inept.

5.name: Spellseeking Gloves
5.description: Spellseeking Gloves are rare Gloves that allow the wearer to spend a Sorcery Point to gain Advantage when making a spell attack roll.
5.quote: Sorcerers operate on a first-come, first-blasted basis.

5.name: Stalker Gloves
5.description: The Stalker Gloves are a rare pair of gloves which improve the wearer's Sneak Attack and Initiative.
5.quote: It's a difficult life being a modern rogue - everyone expects the surprise attack. These gloves assist in making sure that the surprisee doesn't live long enough to decide whether they were surprised.

5.name: Swordmaster Gloves
5.description: The Swordmaster Gloves are a rare pair of Gloves that grant proficiency in three types of sword and provide a bonus to melee Attack Rolls.
5.quote: The famous drow with his heart of gold, Drizzt Do'Urden, is not the pioneer of the 'twin sword style' of fighting, though he was among the best practitioners.

5.name: The Reviving Hands
5.description: The Reviving Hands are a very rare pair of Gloves that grants the wearer the to ability to cast Revivify and applies Blade Ward and Death Ward to creatures healed or revived by the wearer respectively.
5.quote: Stitched into the lining is the phrase: 'Yes all right, all right, stop moaning and get up.'

5.name: The Sparkle Hands
5.description: The Sparkle Hands are a pair of rare Gloves that grant Lightning Charges  on unarmed attacks and provides Advantage against metal constructs and armoured foes while charged.
5.quote: 'Sometimes I just want to feel that spark,' Yrre the Sparkstruck said. 'Feel the lightning course through me.'

5.name: Thermoarcanic Gloves
5.description: Thermoarcanic Gloves are an uncommon pair of Gloves that grants the wearer 2 turns of Heat whenever they deal Fire|Fire damage.
5.quote: Ash dusts the gloves' fingers, darkening their seams.

5.name: Thunderpalm Strikers
5.image: Gloves of Cinder and Sizzle Icon.png
5.icon: Gloves of Cinder and Sizzle Unfaded Icon.png
5.description: Thunderpalm Strikers are a rare pair of Gloves that add Thunder damage to unarmed attacks and allow the wearer to cast Thunderwave once per Long Rest.
5.quote: Each blow landed while wearing these gloves produces the rumbling boom of a thousand demons' ravenous stomachs.

5.name: Unlucky Thief's Gloves
5.description: Unlucky Thief's Gloves are an uncommon Gloves that grants the wearer +2 to Sleight of Hand checks.
5.quote: Whenever the wearer steals anything, a piece of coal appears in their pocket, like a tiny, dusty condemnation.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Adds a piece of Charcoal to the wearer's inventory for each item they steal.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
