11.description: Swires' Sledboard is a very rare shield that grants the wearer Force Conduit at the start of combat. It also grants Shield Bash.
11.quote: A gnomish adventurer once used this to outpace his enemies down a slope.

effects.name: Shield Bash:
effects.description: When a foe hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to knock them Prone unless they succeed a Dexterity SavingThrow.

11.name: The Real Sparky Sparkswall
11.icon: The Real Sparky Sparkswall Unfaded Icon.png
11.description: The Real Sparky Sparkswall is an uncommon Shield that allows the wearer to create a Lightning Aura.
11.quote: 'Is there anything as beautiful as lightning striking all around you?' Yrre the Sparkstruck said, letting lightning strike all around them.

effects.name: Lightning Aura
effects.description: Consume 3 Lightning Charges and release a blast of electricity that damages and Jolts nearby enemies.

11.name: Viconia's Walking Fortress
11.description: Viconia's Walking Fortress is a legendary shield that can deal Force|Force damage to the attacker when hit. Gives Advantage on saving throws against spells and Disadvantage to spell attacks made against the wearer.
11.quote: 'Walking Fortress' is a defensive technique reliant on a shield of this caliber. It involves upsetting your opponent who just wants to land a single blow.

effects.name: Rebuke of the Mighty
effects.description: When a foe hits you with a melee attack, you can use your Reaction to deal them 2~8|Force damage and knock them Prone unless they succeed a Dexterity SavingThrow.

effects.name: Reflective Shell
effects.description: Can cast once per Short Rest.

effects.name: Warding Bond
effects.description: Can cast at Level 2, once per Long Rest.

11.name: Watcher's Shield
11.description: Watcher's Shield is an uncommon Shield that gives the wielder Advantage on Perception Checks.
11.quote: To hold this shield is to be vigilant in duty, wary of danger, and mindful in crisis.

11.name: Wood Woad Shield
11.description: Wood Woad Shield is an uncommon Shield found on Wood Woads and grants its wearer the ability to cast Woad's Ensnaring Strike.
11.quote: 'And with her arm the dryad linked a man who had once been her lover, and once of flesh and bone. Now his flesh was bark, and his bone heartwood. In his eyes a feverish love still blazed like a thousand fireflies in a spring meadow.'

12.name: Battleaxe
12.quote: Tiny scratches mar the metal -- a testament of someone sharpening this axe over and over.

12.name: Battleaxe +1
12.quote: The intricate engravings on this axe's blade and handle make plain the skill of its smith.

12.name: Ceremonial Battleaxe
12.description:
Ceremonial Battleaxe is an uncommon, lightly enchanted (+1) variant of the Battleaxes family of weapons. It is a martial melee weapon that can be wielded in one hand, or with both hands for extra damage.
While it seems to be exactly the same as a Battleaxe +1, it is used for solving the puzzle inside the chapel.
12.quote: The intricate engravings on this axe's blade and handle make plain the skill of its smith.

12.name: Pactbound Battleaxe
12.description: A summoned weapon from Pact of the Blade. It uses the wielder's Spellcasting Ability Modifier, and its damage is magical.
12.quote: A summonable battleaxe granted by a warlock's patron. Its surface crackles with interdimensional energy.

12.name: Thermodynamo Axe
12.description: Thermodynamo Axe is a rare, lightly enchanted (+1) Battleaxe that grants Heat whenever the wielder deals damage with this weapon and an unique weapon action, Maiming Strike (Weapon Action).
12.quote: Designed by gnomish innovation, this weapon has a dynamic core that swivels and tinkles into life whenever the axe is swung at a foe.

12.name: Vicious Battleaxe
12.description: Vicious Battleaxe is a rare Battleaxe that deals additional damage on a Critical Hit.
12.quote: A pulse of magic shoots through your hands whenever you touch this axe.

12.name: Witchbreaker
12.description: Witchbreaker is an uncommon +1 Battleaxe that grants Advantage against concentrating foes and has a unique weapon action, Hush You!.
12.quote: Thou shalt not suffer a witch to... well, keep doing whatever she's doing. It's probably malefic, involving toads and... and things.

13.name: Broken Club
13.quote: The tip of this club has snapped off, it's wood rotten to the core.

13.name: Cemetery-Blue Torch
13.description: Torch is utility item as a light source and doubles as improvised weapon of the Clubs family. It is a simple melee weapon wielded in one hand. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training. Can ignite flammable surfaces or clouds if it makes proper contact.
13.quote: A deep oily smell wafts from this crude tree branch.

13.name: Club
13.description: Club is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the Clubs family of weapons. It is a simple melee weapon wielded in one hand. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training. It is more or less a temporary weapon considering other simple weapons like Mace are superior to it in damage.
13.quote: A long, deep crack runs through the side of the wood, filled with crusted blood.

13.name: Club +1
13.quote: A long, deep crack runs through the side of the wood, filled with crusted blood.

13.name: Club of Hill Giant Strength
13.description: Club of Hill Giant Strength is an uncommon club that that sets the wearer's Strength to 19.
13.quote: Though this rotting chair leg doesn't look like much, every splinter vibrates with barely-contained power.

13.name: Cultist Brand
13.quote: Wrought from a single piece of twisted iron. Bits of charred flesh cling to the strange symbol shaped at the end.

13.name: Drunk-Purple Torch
13.description: Torch is utility item as a light source and doubles as improvised weapon of the Clubs family. It is a simple melee weapon wielded in one hand. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training. Can ignite flammable surfaces or clouds if it makes proper contact.
13.quote: A deep oily smell wafts from this crude tree branch.

13.name: Ironwood Club
13.icon: Wood Woad Twisting Branch Unfaded Icon.png
13.description: Ironwood Club is an uncommon +1 Club that deals extra Bludgeoning|Bludgeoning damage when Shillelagh is cast on it.
13.quote: Fashioned from the hard, unforgiving trunk of an oak, this club still retains the perfume of the forest.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: When Shillelagh is cast on this weapon, grants Ironwood Harmony (+1d4 Bludgeoning damage).

effects.name: Ironwood Club
effects.description: When Shillelagh is cast on this weapon, grants Ironwood Harmony (+1d4 Bludgeoning damage).

13.name: Lantern
13.description: Lantern is utility item as a light source and doubles as improvised weapon of the Clubs family. It is a simple melee weapon wielded in one hand. It's a works exactly like a Torch in utility and combat functions.
13.quote: A deep oily smell wafts from this crude tree branch.

13.name: Moonlantern
13.description: The Moonlantern is a special utility item that sheds a magical light in a large radius while equipped.
13.quote: Each framed facet of the lantern glass is pierced by lances and long tendrils of eerily beautiful moonlight.

13.name: Plague-Green Torch
13.description: Torch is utility item as a light source and doubles as improvised weapon of the Clubs family. It is a simple melee weapon wielded in one hand. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training. Can ignite flammable surfaces or clouds if it makes proper contact.
13.quote: A deep oily smell wafts from this crude tree branch.

13.name: Salami
13.icon: FOOD Dried Beef Sausage Unfaded Icon.png
13.quote: A boon to any adventurer - delicious, long-lasting, and hard enough to smack an adversary.

13.name: Shadow Lantern
13.description: Shadow Lantern is a unique type of Moonlantern which does not produce light and grants the unique Conjure Shadow Lantern Wraith spell.
13.quote: Encased in a cocoon of shadow within the lantern, the mangled pixie lies like some deformed pupa, its mouth slack, and those same shadows crawling over its graying tongue.

13.name: Torch
13.description: Torch is utility item as a light source and doubles as improvised weapon of the Clubs family. It is a simple melee weapon wielded in one hand. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training. Can ignite flammable surfaces or clouds if it makes proper contact.
13.quote: A deep oily smell wafts from this crude tree branch.

13.name: Torch of Revocation
13.description: Torch of Revocation is a very rare +1 utility item carried by Mystic Carrion and used in exorcisms.
13.quote: This staple of any worthwhile exorcist burns with a pale flame that destroys the anchors of troublesome ghosts in need of banishment.

13.name: Twisting Branch
13.icon: Wood Woad Twisting Branch Unfaded Icon.png
13.quote: A thick, gnarled branch, grown into a club-like shape.

13.name: Whipping Cane
13.description: Whipping Cane is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the Clubs family of weapons. It is a simple melee weapon wielded in one hand. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training. It has the same stats as a Club, making it a relatively useless weapon.
13.quote: A cane designed to inflict a sharp and agonizing pain with every blow.

14.name: Artificial Leech
14.quote: Though blood and age have rusted the mechanism, a good twist can still make the blades on this bloodletting device spin.

14.name: Artificial Leech (+1)
14.description: Artificial Leech is an uncommon +1 Dagger that grants non player characters the Bloodletting weapon action.
14.quote: Though blood and age have rusted the mechanism, a good twist can still make the blades on this bloodletting device spin.

14.name: Assassin's Touch
14.description: Assassin's Touch is an uncommon +1 dagger that deals additional damage to Sleeping or Knocked Out targets.
14.quote: This long, slender blade fits perfectly between the ribs of any unsuspecting victim.

14.name: Bloodthirst
14.description: Bloodthirst is a legendary Dagger wielded by Orin that makes critical hits more likely and can make targets vulnerable to Piercing|Piercing or more likely to be hit, depending on which hand the weapon is equipped on.
14.quote: The Lord of Murder wasn't always a lord. He was once just a petty killer. When Bhaal first drew blood in a Baldurian back-alley, it dropped to the ground and lingered. When he ascended, this dried blood-drop grew, warped - and became sharp.

effects.name: Bloodthirst
effects.description:
True Strike|level=0|recharge=Short Rest|action type=Bonus
Bound Weapon
ArmourClass +1 (Off-Hand Only)

14.name: Cold Snap
14.description: Cold Snap is a rare Dagger that chills enemies that attack and miss the wielder and increases the wielder's Armour Class if worn in the off-hand.
14.quote: In the steel, you can see small ice formations like bubbles in a bath, and even hear them pop with crickling crackles of frosted delight.

14.name: Dagger
14.quote: A rogue's favourite toy.

14.name: Dagger +1
14.quote: This dagger's handle is smooth and light, its jagged blade sharpened into a thin, cruel edge.

14.name: Dagger +2
14.quote: A light, slender blade, magically honed to stay razor-sharp.

14.name: Dolor Amarus
14.description: Dolor Amarus is a rare +2 dagger that deals 7 additional damage on a critical hit.
14.quote: Once wielded by a murderer, the weapon's handle retains an eerie, clammy warmth, as if Dolor's pre-slaughter sweat somehow crept into the leather - and lingers there still.

14.name: Dread Iron Dagger
14.description: Dread Iron Dagger is a rare +1 Dagger that deals extra Necrotic|Necrotic damage while the wielder is Hidden.
14.quote: A web of veins runs the length of the blade - it has become a slender iron mortuary for all the innocents it has tasted.

14.name: Gleamdance Dagger
14.description: Gleamdance Dagger is a rare +2 Dagger that sheds light in a radius and increases the wielder's Armour Class, provided it is equipped in the wielder's off-hand.
14.quote: A pair of pixie wings were used to create this pretty blade - their delicate tracings can be seen all day and night, though they shine brightest by the light of a gibbous moon.

14.name: Hunter's Dagger
14.description: Hunter's Dagger is an uncommon +1 Dagger that can Rupture the target on a hit.
14.quote: Prey often thinks it has escaped the worst of the predator's bloodthirst and fury - but there are always further torments to be meted out.

14.name: Murderous Cut
14.description: Murderous Cut is an uncommon +1 Dagger that deals extra Piercing|Piercing damage to targets with less than half their maximum Hit points.
14.quote: Odd to think that dark gods like Bhaal were once mortal. One wonders if they ever thumbed a wagon ride, thought about the weather, or ate flavoured yoghurt.

14.name: Needle of the Outlaw Rogue
14.image: Needle of the Outlaw Rogue Faded.png
14.icon: Needle of the Outlaw Rogue Unfaded Icon.png
14.quote: A dagger that thrums with desire - a longing for vengeance.

14.name: Polished Dagger
14.quote: The dagger's leather grip is stamped with a stag's head - the symbol of the Emerald Enclave.

14.name: Poo-Scraper
14.quote: Fecund and revolting, the Abyss is not the worst place this has been.

14.name: Rhapsody
14.description: Rhapsody is a very rare, +1 Dagger that grants better Attack Rolls, damage, and Spell Save DC for every foe slain (up to 3) and possibly inflicts Bleeding while the wielder is Hiding or Invisible.
14.quote: Cazador's love of poetry arose after he read on the naked stomach of a dead child in his homeland. The child was hung from the lowest branch of a tree. Cazador read the poem, and looked at the child, and he knew that here was the artform for him.

14.name: Ritual Dagger
14.description: Ritual Dagger is an uncommon dagger that temporarily Blesses the wielder when dealing damage to an enemy - or to themselves.
14.quote: The leader handle is smooth with use, and slick with fresh blood.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: name=Blood Sacrifice|link=Blood Sacrifice|icon=Blood Sacrifice Icon|action type=bonus|description=Pain is a path to power. Take {{DamageText|1d4|Slashing damage to receive a +1d4 bonus to Attack Rolls and Saving Throws.}}

effects.name: Ritual Dagger
effects.description: name=Blood Sacrifice|link=Blood Sacrifice|icon=Blood Sacrifice Icon|action type=bonus|description=Pain is a path to power. Take {{DamageText|1d4|Slashing damage to receive a +1d4 bonus to Attack Rolls and Saving Throws.}}

14.name: Ritual Dagger of Shar
14.description: Ritual Dagger of Shar is an uncommon +1 Dagger that deals an additional Necrotic|1d4 Necrotic damage on a hit.
14.quote: The blade is sharp, and the handle firm. Yet death exudes from this dagger as it might from a fresh corpse.

14.name: Rusted Blade
14.quote: Ages of rust have eaten away at this blood-soaked knife.

14.name: Rusty Dagger
14.quote: Useful for writing your name in damp slush and not much else.

14.name: Scalpel
14.quote: Scalpel

14.name: Stillmaker
14.description: Stillmaker is a very rare +2 Dagger that grants the wielder the Hold Person spell once per Long Rest.
14.quote: The dagger's twisting blade is designed to nick the flesh as many times as possible, allowing its paralytic poison to flow effortlessly into any unfortunate target.

14.name: Sussur Dagger
14.description: The Sussur Dagger is a rare +1 Dagger that silences the targets it strikes, making it very effective against spellcasters.
14.quote: Smoke-like whorls of sussur sap darken the metal of this dagger's blade and silence its victims.

14.name: Syringe
14.quote: The yellowish-green ooze dried to the syringe's long needle gives you the distinct impression that this medical device was never used to heal anyone.

14.name: Syringe (+1)
14.description: Syringe is an uncommon +1 Dagger that grants the Inject Nostrum weapon action to non player characters only.
14.quote: The yellowish-green ooze dried to the syringe's long needle gives you the distinct impression that this medical device was never used to heal anyone.

14.name: Worgfang
14.description: Worgfang is an uncommon dagger that grants the wielder defensive capabilities against Goblins.  Any goblin attacking the wielder of Worgfang suffers from disadvantage on its Attack Rolls.
14.quote: ‘No goblin will strike you down’ is etched into this dagger's handle.  When goblin assailants realised they couldn't kill the dagger's original owner, they gave him to the worgs, who made short work of him.

16.name: Corrosive Flail
16.description: Corrosive Flail is a rare +1 Flail that grants a special weapon action, Corrosive Strike.
16.quote: Acid was long ago abandoned by assassins, who found poison much more reliable in spiking their target's drinks. The acid kept melting the chalices.

16.name: Defender Flail
16.description: The Defender Flail is a rare +1 Flail that reduces physical weapon damage to the wearer and increases Armour Class.
16.quote: This flail was created to commemorate victory over the devil Belhifet. It has since made its way so far from Easthaven that the locals have long forgotten that chapter of their town's past.

16.name: Flail
16.quote: The head of this flail is shiny and new, its wooden shaft still coarse and unmarked by blood.

16.name: Flail +1
16.quote: A browning piece of brain sticks stubbornly to one of the spikes.

16.name: Flail +2
16.quote: The flail sits heavy in your hand - the weight of steel and magic.

16.name: Flail of Ages
16.description: Flail of Ages is a rare Flail that applies variable conditions depending on what type of damage the flail does.
16.quote: Created by a warmongering rakshasa and kept for a time under the careful watch of an astute noble name Lord de'Arnise, this flail is a tool of absolute destruction, and a versatile one at that.

16.name: Flail of Myrkul
16.quote: A browning piece of brain sticks stubbornly to one of the spikes.

16.name: Flail of the Vortex
16.icon: Flail of the Vortex Unfaded Icon.png

16.name: Myrkulite Scourge
16.description: Myrkulite Scourge is an uncommon Flail with a +1 Enchantment and deals an additional Necrotic|1d6 Necrotic damage on a strike.
16.quote: A browning piece of brain sticks stubbornly to one of the spikes.

17.name: Drakethroat Glaive
17.description: Drakethroat Glaive is a rare +2 Glaive that grants its wielder the Draconic Elemental Weapon weapon action and a bonus to dragonborn breath racial actions.
17.quote: Kereska, the draconic goddess of arcane knowledge, gifted this glaive to a dragonborn when facing off against a group of carbuncular spiders. How their arachnid legs curled and blackened before that night's dark business was done!

17.name: Glaive
17.description: Glaive is a common variant of the Glaives family of weapons.
17.quote: Simple but sharp.  The shaft of this glaive is worn smooth with use.

17.name: Glaive +1
17.description: Glaive +1 is an uncommon, lightly enchanted glaive.
17.quote: Fashioned by expert elven hands to be both deadly and beautiful.

17.name: Monster Slayer Glaive
17.description: Monster Slayer Glaive is a rare +1 glaive that deals additional damage against Monstrosities and increases its wielder's Jump distance.
17.quote: Monster-slaying is a rare calling, not for the faint of heart. It requires temperance, discipline, and usually a very big stick with something pointy at the end. The best thing about spears is that the ugly parts of combat are happening at the other end.

17.name: Moonlight Glaive
17.description: Moonlight Glaive is a rare +2 glaive that deals additional Radiant|Radiant damage, has a permanent Light effect, and grants its wielder the Moonlight Butterflies weapon action.
17.quote: A gift from Dame Aylin and her radiant goddess, this weapon's contours hold a silver-white beauty akin to the nightly lantern that climbs the firmament each evening.

17.name: Pactbound Glaive
17.description: A summoned weapon from Pact of the Blade. It uses the wielder's Spellcasting Ability Modifier, and its damage is magical.
17.quote: A summonable glaive granted by a warlock's patron. Its surface crackles with interdimensional energy.

17.name: Sorrow
17.description: Sorrow is a rare glaive that grants its wielder the Sorrowful Lash cantrip as bonus action once per turn.
17.quote: For every drop of blood spilled, a piece of the soul perishes - until nothing remains but regret.

17.name: The Dancing Breeze
17.description: The Dancing Breeze is a very rare glaive that grants its wielder the Whirlwind Attack weapon action, which strikes all nearby targets.
17.quote: Tiny specks of blood are fused into the blade, as if the glaive is feeding on them.

18.name: Blooded Greataxe
18.description: Blooded Greataxe is a rare +1 greataxe that deals additional Physical|Slashing damage when the wielder has 50% hit points or less.
18.quote: Stained brown and reeking of iron, this greataxe once belonged to a killer so deranged, his name was magically scrubbed from all histories.

18.name: Defender Greataxe
18.description: Defender Greataxe is a rare +2 greataxe that can be reduced in its enchantment on the first attack of the round to increase wielder's Armour Class and saving throw bonus.
18.quote: The power of this axe lies in a fluctuating arcane enchantment that flows between the beard and the edge of the axe, and the wielder themselves.

18.name: Exterminator's Axe
18.description: Exterminator's Axe is an uncommon greataxe that deals additional Fire|Fire damage to Plants, Insects, and Small creatures.
18.quote: The intricate engravings on this axe's blade and handle make plain the skill of its smith.

18.name: Greataxe
18.description: Greataxe is a common variant of the Greataxes family of weapons.
18.quote: The rectangular engravings on this axe's wooden handle have been nearly scratched away by armoured hands.

18.name: Greataxe +1
18.description: Greataxe +1 is an uncommon, lightly enchanted greataxe.
18.quote: A small prayer decorates the hilt of this axe. It resonates in your head when you touch it.

18.name: Greataxe +2
18.description: Greataxe +2 is a rare, moderately enchanted greataxe.
18.quote: This heavy axe emits a barely audible hum when swung.

18.name: Hellfire Greataxe
18.description: Hellfire Greataxe is a very rare greataxe that deals additional Fire|Fire damage, afflicts its wielder with Heat on each successful hit, and grants the Hellflame Cleave weapon action.
18.quote: Anything hit by this has the life expectancy of a glass hammer.

18.name: Sethan
18.description: Sethan is a very rare greataxe that grants its wielder the Sethan: Spiritual Greataxe and Sethan: Reduce weapon actions.
18.quote: When this axe careens through the air towards an unfortunate head - the whistle of its spiritual counterpart is never far behind.

18.name: The Undead Bane
18.description: The Undead Bane is an uncommon greataxe that deals additional Physical|Slashing damage against Fiends and Undead and grants its wielder the Profane Scourge weapon action.
18.quote: Wielded by the indomitable Ser Lexia. Although her eagerness to destroy evil in all its forms was constant, she often took time to make little gifts for her friends.

18.name: Very Heavy Greataxe
18.description: Very Heavy Greataxe is an uncommon greataxe that grants its wielder the Gargantuan Cleave weapon action, which can strike multiple targets but make the wielder Off-Balanced for 1 turn.

19.name: Argument Solver
19.description: Argument Solver is an uncommon +1 Greatclub that grants the wielder the Poison Mist weapon action, which deals extra Poison|Poison damage and creates a poison cloud.
19.quote: Few things solve a disagreement faster than displaying a greatclub. And this one reeks, too.

19.name: Greatclub
19.quote: Traces of dried viscera ring many of the iron spikes embedded in this oak club.

19.name: Greatclub +1
19.quote: Without the wrapped leather grip, the weight of the slab of iron at the end of this greatclub would send it flying with a single swing.

19.name: Punch-Drunk Bastard
19.description: Punch-Drunk Bastard is a rare +1 Greatclub that grants the wielder Advantage and creates a Thunder|Thunder blast on each hit...so long as the wielder is Drunk.
19.quote: You see... *hic* the thing... the really, really important thing *hic*... about this item is *belches copiously*... oh sod it, it's a club. Enjoy.

19.name: Rat Bat
19.description: The Rat Bat is a rare greatclub that grants the wielder Advantage on their Attack Rolls against beasts.
19.quote: A club with nails hammered through it. Classic.

20.name: Balduran's Giantslayer
20.description: Balduran's Giantslayer is a legendary greatsword that receives doubled damage bonus from Strength, grants its wielder the Giant Form class action and the Topple the Big Folk weapon action, as well as Advantage on attack rolls against Large, Huge, and Gargantuan creatures.
20.quote: Wielded by Balduran, the founder of Baldur's Gate and friend to his guardian dragon, a great glittering wyrm called Ansur. Fellowship can be undone, though, as easily as you or I might unlace the strings of our shoes, and it was in a time of skullduggery and hardship that Balduran killed Ansur, carrying out the deed with this sword.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: name=Giant Form|link=Giant Form|icon=Generic Utility Icon|description=Grow to a fearsome size. Your weapons deal an additional 1d6 damage and you gain {{Temp hp|27 and Advantage on Strength Checks and Saving Throws.|action type=action|recharge=Short Rest}}

effects.name: Balduran's Giantslayer
effects.description: name=Giant Form|link=Giant Form|icon=Generic Utility Icon|description=Grow to a fearsome size. Your weapons deal an additional 1d6 damage and you gain {{Temp hp|27 and Advantage on Strength Checks and Saving Throws.|action type=action|recharge=Short Rest}}

20.name: Everburn Blade
20.description: Everburn Blade is an uncommon greatsword that deals additional |Fire damage.
20.quote: Silent flames surge the length of the blade as soon as it clears the scabbard.

20.name: Githyanki Greatsword
20.description: The Githyanki Greatsword is an uncommon, slightly enchanted greatsword.
20.quote: Though heavily decorated and inlaid with rubies, the blade's sharp edge suggests its use isn't merely ornamental.

20.name: Githyanki Greatsword (Psionic)
20.description: Githyanki Greatsword is an uncommon greatsword that deals additional Psychic|Psychic damage when wielded by a githyanki.
20.quote: Though heavily decorated and inlaid with rubies, the blade's sharp edge suggests its use isn't merely ornamental.

20.name: Greatsword
20.description: Greatsword is a common variant of the Greatswords family of weapons.
20.quote: This sword's guard, held haphazardly in place by thin rope, wobbles slightly when swung.

20.name: Greatsword +1
20.description: Greatsword +1 is an uncommon, lightly enchanted greatsword.
20.quote: The thick leather straps wrapped around the base of the blade creak under a solid grip.

20.name: Greatsword +1 (Common)
20.description: Greatsword +1 is a common variant of the Greatswords family of weapons.
20.quote: A rune etched into the base of this expertly-forged sword identifies its dwarven blacksmith.

20.name: Jorgoral's Greatsword
20.description: Jorgoral's Greatsword is a rare +1 greatsword that grants its wielder the Colossal Onslaught weapon action.
20.quote: Strong castle-forged steel surmounts a grip of sturdy leather - this immense sword is capable of disembowelling giants in a single swipe.

20.name: Pactbound Greatsword
20.description: A summoned weapon from Pact of the Blade. It uses the wielder's Spellcasting Ability Modifier, and its damage is magical.
20.quote: A summonable greatsword granted by a warlock's patron. Its surface crackles with interdimensional energy.

20.name: Reinforced Greatsword
20.description: Reinforced Greatsword is a common variant of the Greatswords family of weapons.
20.quote: This cumberstone blade looks strong enough to survive journey through all nine Hells.

20.name: Rusty Greatsword
20.description: Rusty Greatsword is a common variant of the Greatswords family of weapons.
20.quote: Large and crusted with rust, and about as useful as a drink of water to a drowning man.

20.name: Silver Sword of the Astral Plane
20.description: Silver Sword of the Astral Plane is a legendary greatsword that grants its wielder the Soulbreaker weapon action and provides special bonuses when wielded by a githyanki.
20.quote: The fervour with which the githyanki express devotion to their queen is admirable to some, disquieting to others. When confronted with the fallibility of the divine (since no one is wholly perfect), who knows what reactions such folk might evince.

20.name: Soulbreaker Greatsword
20.description: Soulbreaker Greatsword is a rare +1 greatsword that grants its wielder the Soulbreaker weapon action and a bonus to Initiative rolls, and deals additional Psychic|Psychic damage when wielded by a githyanki.
20.quote: The sharp metal whispers to you. Pleading. Cursing... Echoes of slain foes.

20.name: Sussur Greatsword
20.description: Sussur Greatsword is a rare greatsword that can Silence targets on a successful hit.
20.quote: Sussur roots extend from this sword's hilt into the blade itself. It yearns to drink magic, silencing every creature it strikes.

20.name: Svartlebee's Woundseeker
20.description: Svartlebee's Woundseeker is an uncommon +1 greatsword that grants its wielder bonus to Attack Rolls against already damaged creatures.
20.quote: Wielded by Svartlebee The Custodian, so named because he had the following reputation: Have you got someone in your life causing a mess? Send Svartlebee a missive. He shall clean them up, and then clean up the crime scene.

20.name: Sword of Chaos
20.description: Sword of Chaos is a very rare +2 greatsword that deals additional |Necrotic damage and also regains wielder's health on each successful hit.
20.quote: The sword of Sarevok, brother of Gorion's Ward and child of the evil god Bhaal. Though much of its power died with him, the sword is still formidable, and glows with a malevolent light.

20.name: Sword of Justice
20.description: Sword of Justice is an uncommon +1 greatsword that grants its wielder the Tyr's Protection spell.
20.quote: The words 'Deliverance. Justice. Vengeance.' are engraved on the base of this sword. They echo in your mind.

21.name: Halberd
21.description: Halberd is a common variant of the Halberds family of weapons.
21.quote: Part of the spike affixed to the top of this halberd has snapped off, leaving a cruel barb.

21.name: Halberd +1
21.description: Halberd +1 is an uncommon, lightly enchanted halberd.
21.quote: This halberd's spike is black with ash that cannot be washed away.

21.name: Halberd of Vigilance
21.description: Halberd of Vigilance is a very rare halberd that deals additional Force|Force damage, gives a bonus to Initiative, and grants Advantage on Perception checks and Reactions.
21.quote: A variant of this halberd's design was thrown out in the early stages of development by its forgemaster. This was because the halberd kept expressing itself. 'ALARM!' it would shriek in peril. 'POTENCY FILLS ME LIKE A SONG OF HOPE!' it roared in triumph.

21.name: Harmonium Halberd
21.description: Harmonium Halberd is a rare halberd that grants its wielder additional Strength at the cost of some Intelligence and Wisdom.
21.quote: The platinum inlays of this halberd hum an otherworldy harmony in the key of C, heightening the wielder's vigour but diminishing their mental faculties. The sound it makes is pining, as if far from its rightful home.

21.name: Hellbeard Halberd
21.description: Hellbeard Halberd is a rare halberd that deals additional |Poison damage.
21.quote: Salvaged from the beard of a dead infernal leviathan, whose facial hair was formed from the weapons of an army it had once vanquished.

21.name: Light of Creation
21.description: Light of Creation is an uncommon halberd that deals additional Lightning|Lightning damage, but has a chance to Stun its wielder on each successful attack.
21.quote: Small lodestones have been inserted along the halberd's shaft, a strange blue current running through them.

21.name: Merregon Halberd
21.description: Merregon Halberd is an uncommon, lightly enchanted halberd.
21.quote: Sharp teeth grow out of the halberd's dark metal - if it is indeed metal at all.

21.name: Rusty Halberd
21.quote: A dilapidated old shanker of a weapon.

21.name: The Skinburster
21.description: The Skinburster is an uncommon +1 halberd that grants its wielder Force Conduit on each successful hit.
21.quote: In mellow light, the halberd's curved steel head eerily resembles a grin.

22.name: Cleaver
22.quote: Stained with blood and gore, the handle has almost rusted through.

22.name: Comeback Handaxe
22.quote: This loyal axe always returns to its owner after being thrown. However, it has no eyes and therefore dreadful aim, inevitably returning to its thrower blade-end-first.

22.name: Dad's Axe
22.quote: An old woodcutter's axe, infused with a shadow's bleak curse.

22.name: Dragon's Grasp
22.description: Dragon's Grasp is an uncommon Handaxe that deals extra Slashing damage to Burning targets.
22.quote: Somehow, this axe is perpetually feels warm to the touch.

22.name: Handaxe
22.quote: A straightforward hatchet, dulled slightly from wood - or bones.

22.name: Handaxe +1
22.quote: This axe's hooked blade is crafted to cleave flesh and bone.

22.name: Ritual Axe
22.description: Ritual Axe is an uncommon Handaxe that inflicts Bane against the wielder's targets.
22.quote: Though shiny and recently polished, dried blood still fills the deepest crevices of this axe.

22.name: Rusty Handaxe
22.image: Item WPN HUM Battleaxe A 0 Rusty A Faded.png
22.icon: Item WPN HUM Battleaxe A 0 Rusty A Unfaded Icon.png
22.quote: This handaxe is so banjaxed, it's [sic] only possible use could be as a kind of flaky backscratcher.

23.name: Firestoker
23.description: The Firestoker is an uncommon Hand Crossbow that deals additional damage to Burning targets.
23.quote: Though the crossbow's bolts look burning hot, they are pleasantly warm to the touch.

23.name: Hand Crossbow
23.quote: The spring locks back with the tiniest, most satisfying click.

23.name: Hand Crossbow +1
23.quote: A subtle magic runs through both strings of this crossbow, keeping the bows even once the lack is released.

23.name: Hand Crossbow +2
23.quote: Though the crossbow is small and light, a heavy power runs through its bowstring.

23.name: Hellfire Hand Crossbow
23.description: Hellfire Hand Crossbow is a very rare +2 Hand Crossbow that has a chance to set targets burning when attacking while Hiding or Invisible.
23.quote: Rigged to draw on the skin-peeling hellfire of Avernus by a resourceful devil, this crossbow's size is no indication of its deadly potential.

23.name: Ne'er Misser
23.description: The Ne'er Misser is a rare 1|notext=1 Hand Crossbow that deals Force damage on its attacks and grants the wearer the ability to cast Magic Missile once per short rest as a 3rd level Spell.
23.quote: On the stock, the crafter of this crossbow etched in tiny print: 'Ifn yer gonna miss, why dontchyae stop being a wally, and hit instead!'

24.name: Crossbow of Arcane Force
24.icon: Crossbow of Arcane Force Unfaded Icon.png
24.description: Crossbow of Arcane Force is an uncommon +1 Heavy Crossbow that grants the wielder a special Arcane Ammunition weapon action that adds additional Force|Force damage to ranged attacks.
24.quote: The soft hum of power emanates from the allien metal.

24.name: Fabricated Arbalest
24.description: Fabricated Arbalest is a very rare Heavy Crossbow that grants the wielder the Dazzling Ray and Illuminating Shot weapon actions.
24.quote: A perfect system must be ruled by a keen eye - and any error foolish enough to rear its head afore the eye must be quickly, precisely, and totally eliminated. This crossbow can help with that.

24.name: Gandrel's Aspiration
24.description: Gandrel's Aspiration is an uncommon +1 Heavy Crossbow that grants Advantage against Monstrosity targets and grants the Sacred Munitions class action that Turns Undead.
24.quote: When Gandrel was seven, he was frightened badly by a vampire spawn during a public burning. Seized by the flames, the creature didn't shrivel up. It swelled and burst.

24.name: Giantbreaker
24.description: Giantbreaker is a rare +1 Heavy Crossbow that sends its targets Reeling on a successful hit.
24.quote: Legends say the Giantbreaker earned its name when an elven ranger singlehandedly defeated a score of hill giants. While the ranger's name is long forgotten, Giantbreaker's lives on.

24.name: Githyanki Crossbow
24.quote: This heavy crossbow is fashioned from a curious, tensile metal that doesn't seem to be native to Faerûn.

24.name: Harold
24.description: Harold is a rare +1 Heavy Crossbow that can possibly Bane targets that it hits.
24.quote: Named after Harold Butterbisk, who opened the Butterbisk Inn in Waterdeep before it was renamed by new owners. The stock of the crossbow reads: Quaffing is a shootable offence.

24.name: Heavy Crossbow
24.quote: A standard-issue crossbow, used by many guardsmen.

24.name: Heavy Crossbow +1
24.quote: Despite the heaviness of this crossbow, the latch pulls back with an effortless ease.

24.name: Hellfire Engine Crossbow
24.description: Hellfire Engine Crossbow is a very rare +2 Heavy Crossbow that grants the Lightning Arrow spell and can pull targets with the Reposition Malefactor weapon action.
24.quote: 'Trundling, mashing, mincing, crushing, grinding, blasting, biting! Hear their peeling thunder, their roaring flames, their clicking, whirring, metallic melody, and know that the hellfire engines of Avernus are on the move!' - Edict in Elturel

24.name: Rusty Heavy Crossbow
24.quote: Try firing a bolt from this rust-encrusted stock, see if you keep all your fingers.

24.name: The Long Arm of the Gur
24.description: The Long Arm of the Gur is a rare +2 Heavy Crossbow that grants a bonus to Attack Rolls and Damage Rolls against Undead targets.
24.quote:
When the boy was seven, he was frightened badly by a vampire spawn during a public burning. Seized by the flames, the creature didn't shrivel up. It swelled and burst like a squeezed leech. Brains splattered the boy's shoes, grey-pink and pulpy.

He would never forget it.

25.name: BOOOAL's Arms
25.quote: The cut-off pincer of some Underdark crustacean seems to magically adhere to a bone shaft, creating a make-shift javelin.

25.name: Javelin
25.quote: A rusted fishing harpoon, repurposed as a weapon.

25.name: Javelin +1
25.quote: A rusted fishing harpoon, repurposed as a weapon.

26.name: Light Crossbow
26.quote: This crossbow’s cast iron latch is mottled with blooms of rust.

26.name: Light Crossbow +1
26.quote: Though this crossbow's stock is hollowed out, its heavy trigger mechanism keeps it well balanced.

26.name: Sharran Crossbow
26.description: Sharran Crossbow is an uncommon Light Crossbow, identical to a Light Crossbow +1 aside from the flavour text.
26.quote: A sleek, well-made crossbow that is plain but for the symbol of Shar on the handle.

27.name: Light Hammer
27.quote: A blacksmith's pride and joy, repurposed for combat.  Its steel head is tarnished from years in the forge.

27.name: Light Hammer +1
27.quote: A skillful smith decorated the wooden handle with a fine golden filigree.

27.name: Shining Staver-of-Skulls
27.description: Shining Staver-of-Skulls is an uncommon +1 Light Hammer that sheds Light in a radius around the wielder.
27.quote: Look no further than Scyllua Darkhope - fallen paladin and champion of Bane - to see how the tools of good can be turned to evil purpose.

27.name: Skybreaker
27.icon: Light Hammer B PlusOne Unfaded Icon.png
27.description: Skybreaker is an uncommon +1 Light Hammer that grants the wielder the spell Searing Smite.
27.quote: "And they shall have Celestia's light, even if we must crack wide the heavens to bring it."

27.name: Wulbren's Hammer
27.description: Wulbren's Hammer is an uncommon Light Hammer that deals an extra 2d4 Force|Force damage on each hit against constructs and objects.
27.quote: "Constructs and objects melt beneath this hefty blunt tool when wielded by a sharp mind."

28.name: Gontr Mael
28.description: Gontr Mael is a legendary +3 longbow that can possibly inflict Guiding Bolt on its target and grants the wielder the Celestial Haste spell and Bolt of Celestial Light actions.
28.quote: "Gontr Mael blasted from the corpse of the Steelwatcher Titan: a bow formed from the boiling slag and weird whispering gyros inherent to the mechanical giant. It must have acted as the Titan's abdomen, exchanging muscle for immaculate steel."

28.name: Hellrider Longbow
28.description: Hellrider Longbow is an uncommon +1 Longbow that grants the wielder a large bonus to Initiative and Advantage on Perception checks. It may also apply Faerie Fire to a creature on a successful attack.
28.quote: This longbow was forged from the remnants of Stanislav the Silver's shield, found near the wreckage of Castle Ravenloft some years ago.

28.name: Longbow
28.quote: During the Crown Wars, the demand for longbows was such that adult yew trees were almost driven to extinction.

28.name: Longbow +1
28.quote: Carved enchantments span the length of this supple bow.

28.name: Longbow +2
28.quote: A soothing hum drifts through your head whenever you draw this bow.

28.name: Sahuagin Longbow
28.quote: Carved enchantments span the length of this supple bow.

28.name: Spellthief
28.description: Spellthief is an uncommon Longbow that allows the wielder to recover a level 1 Spell Slot if they land a Critical Hit, once per Short Rest.
28.quote: A shiver of magic flows from this bow into your hand - like a promise.

28.name: The Dead Shot
28.description: The Dead Shot is a +2 Longbow that increases the accuracy of the wielder as well as increases the chance of a critical hit.
28.quote: When the archer Frederik Durlusk died, his only request was to be buried with his favorite bow. This is that bow.

28.name: The Joltshooter
28.description: The Joltshooter is a rare Longbow that allows the wielder to generate Lightning Charges upon dealing damage with this weapon.
28.quote: Sleek and lightweight, it is said that the Joltshooter was Yrre the Sparkstruck's favourite weapon. They were indifferent towards bows, but the spikes jutting out of it?

28.name: Titanstring Bow
28.description: Titanstring Bow is a rare +1 Longbow that allows its wielder to add their Strength Modifier to damage dealt with this weapon.
28.quote: The commonly held belief that archers are rangey, thin-wristed people is completely false. It takes years of training to pull a bowstring all the way back to your cheekbone, and wrists like iron.

29.name: Adamantine Longsword
29.description: Adamantine Longsword is a rare +1 Longsword that automatically critical hits objects and ignores Resistance to Slashing|Slashing damage.
29.quote: Though heavy, this longsword swings effortlessly in your hand -- ready to take down a hundred enemies.

29.name: Battle-Worn Blade
29.quote: A fine but well-used sword. It seemed to have once belonged to a holy order, but the indication of rank and patron deity at the hilt have recently been filed down.

29.name: Blackguard's Sword
29.description: Blackguard's Sword is a rare +2 Longsword that possibly Dazes targets that have been Smited by the wielder.
29.quote: Formerly wielded by one who forsook all ties of friendship and kindness, this sword is rife with deranged energies. It seems to transmit feelings of contentment when carving through bones.

29.name: Blade of Oppressed Souls
29.quote: Fragments of dead souls are imprisoned in the steel. Angry, powerful, hopeful, or scared - all of them rose up against their illithid masters, and all of them fell to this blade. Now, they are trapped forever, forced to aid their opressors.

29.name: Bonesaw
29.quote: The saw's teeth are blunt and rusted, it's beautiful metalwork barely visible beneath a layer of black, coagulated blood.

29.name: Bonesaw (+1)
29.description: Bonesaw is an uncommon +1 Longsword that grants non player characters the weapon action Incise Ligaments.
29.quote: The saw's teeth are blunt and rusted, it's beautiful metalwork barely visible beneath a layer of black, coagulated blood.

29.name: Ceremonial Longsword
29.description: Ceremonial Longsword is an uncommon, lightly enchanted longsword.
29.quote: A complex filigree wraps around the base of this blade - the runes on the side suggesting it is not merely decorative.

29.name: Cruel Sting
29.description: Cruel Sting is a rare +1 Longsword that deals extra Poison|Poison damage  against Restrained targets if the wielder is a drow elf. It also grants the Ensnaring Strands spell.
29.quote: The trauma of becoming a drider is quickly set aside with a cold arachnid dispassion. This sword follows that disturbing trend - a replenishing poison gland is built within, deployed only against trapped opponents.

29.name: Duke Ravengard's Longsword
29.description: Duke Ravengard's Longsword is a rare, +1 Longsword that grants the wielder temporary hit points to allies equal to the wielder's Charisma modifier, and also increases the wielder's Charisma by +2.
29.quote: Cradling his newborn son awkwardly, the Duke's face pulled into a rictus of misery. His love Francesca smiled at him, briefly, and died. He stared at her until the boy cried, and he told the boy it would be all right, though he himself did not believe it.

effects.name: Commander's Strike
effects.description: Direct an ally to strike a foe. The ally uses a Reaction on their next turn to make a weapon attack. Once per Short Rest.

29.name: Githyanki Longsword
29.quote: Every tip and edge on this elaborate sword is sharpened to a deadly perfection.

29.name: Githyanki Longsword (+1)
29.icon: Githyanki Longsword Plus One Unfaded Icon.png
29.description: Githyanki Longsword is an uncommon, lightly enchanted longsword.
29.quote: Every tip and edge on this elaborate sword is sharpened to a deadly perfection.

29.name: Katana
29.quote: The hilt of this slender sword is wrapped with soft, black silk — the dark colour hiding any possible stains.

29.name: King's Knife
29.description: King's Knife is a Duergar variant of the common Longsword. It is identical to a Longsword in all but appearance.
29.quote: Crudely forged with mismatched components, nearly rusted through, and plenty sharp.

29.name: Larethian's Wrath
29.description: Larethian's Wrath is a rare +1 Longsword that grants the wielder the Razor Gale weapon action.
29.quote: Deceptively light, the blade rasps through castle-forged plate as easily as Corellon Larethian's own anarchic holy sword through the hearts of evil orcs.

29.name: Longsword
29.quote: A common sword, passed between hands both fresh and battle-scarred.

29.name: Longsword +1
29.quote: A complex filigree wraps around the base of this blade - the runes on the side suggesting it is not merely decorative.

29.name: Longsword +2
29.quote: This longsword never dulls, although an observer may notice it quietly drinks the blood of slain enemies.

29.name: Phalar Aluve
29.description: Phalar Aluve is a rare +1 Longsword that can be made to Shriek or Sing, granting nearby allies or enemies a bonus to Attack Rolls or damage or damage rolls, depending on the choice.
29.quote: The Drow inscription on this blade appears to have been recently carved. It translates to;"'Though I have to leave you, I will dance forever in Eilistraee's Light.'"

effects.name: Phalar Aluve: Melody
effects.description: The sword hums in anticipation, ready to Sing or Shriek. Effect ends if Phalar Aluve is unequipped.

29.name: Rusty Longsword
29.quote: Mottled with rust, this longsword is a hideous excuse for a blade.

29.name: Sword of the Emperor
29.description: Sword of the Emperor is a rare +2 Longsword that grants bonus damage against shapeshifted or polymorphed creatures and enhances the wielder's defences against spells.
29.quote: There's a graceful swarthiness to this sword. The inscription in the steel reads - 'My eye wanders far from home / To shores of distant Anchorome.'

29.name: Voss' Silver Sword
29.description: Voss' Silver Sword is a very rare +2 Longsword enhanced with additional Psychic damage. Also, it grants a bonus to damage and Attack Rolls against githyanki, aberrations, fiends and elementals and grants the wearer the ability to cast the Wrathful Smite spell.
29.quote: Heavy and grouted in the gore of countless centuries, this prototype for the contemporary githyanki silver sword was wielded during their rebellion against the mind flayers who enslaved them.

30.name: Adamantine Mace
30.description: Adamantine Mace is a rare +1 Mace that automatically critical hits objects and ignores Resistance to Bludgeoning|Bludgeoning damage.
30.quote: A nimble mace, heavy with the promise of broken bones.

30.name: Ceremonial Mace
30.quote: The leather handle of this mace smells badly of rotting blood.

30.name: Crude Mace
30.quote: Rotten rags and mud are the only things keeping this mace together.

30.name: Deva Mace
30.description: Deva Mace is a common variant of the Maces family of weapons wielded by Deva.
30.quote: The golden slopes of the celestial heavens are filled with angels. Theistic scholars don't know what they do, but whatever it is, they do it holy.

30.name: Devotee's Mace
30.description: The Devotee's Mace is a legendary, +3 Mace that deals extra Radiant|Radiant damage on hit, and can create a healing aura that heals the wielder and nearby allies.
30.quote: This weapon is favoured by celestial devas, the vanguards of the divine ranks of paradise.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: name=Healing Incense Aura|link=Healing Incense Aura|action type=bonus|icon=Healing Incense Aura Icon|description=Emanating a soothing aura, You and nearby allies regain {{DamageText|1d4|Healing at the start of your turn for 10 turns|recharge=Long Rest}}

effects.name: Devotee's Mace
effects.description: name=Healing Incense Aura|link=Healing Incense Aura|action type=bonus|icon=Healing Incense Aura Icon|description=Emanating a soothing aura, You and nearby allies regain {{DamageText|1d4|Healing at the start of your turn for 10 turns|recharge=Long Rest}}

30.name: Handmaiden's Mace
30.description: Handmaiden's Mace is a very rare +2 Mace that sets the wielder's Strength to 18.
30.quote: This mace was designed by Lolth's assassins to fell heretics who dared turn their back on the Spider Queen. However, even the best-laid designs fall to nothingness when brought to bear against Shar's faithfull.

30.name: Infernal Mace
30.description: Infernal Mace is a rare +1 Mace that deals an extra 3 Poison|Poison damage and possibly Poisons the target on a hit.
30.quote: Precise infernal runes are woven into this weapon's filigree, implying a creator well-versed in hellish arcana.

30.name: Loviatar's Scourge
30.description: Loviatar's Scourge is an uncommon Mace that grants the wielder resistance to Necrotic|Necrotic damage. It also deals additional Necrotic|Necrotic damage to all nearby creatures, including the wielder.
30.quote: More club than scourge, this weapon has a serrated edge made for drawing long, shallow cuts.

30.name: Mace
30.quote: A simple but effective mace, cast en masse by human blacksmiths.

30.name: Mace +1
30.quote: The leather handle of this mace smells badly of rotting blood.

30.name: Mace +2
30.quote: The shallow etchings along this mace's head seem to change shape, depending on the light.

30.name: Rusty Mace
30.quote: The head of this mace is a scratchboard of peeling orange rust.

30.name: Shattered Flail
30.description: Shattered Flail is a rare +2 Mace that heals the wielder when they hit an enemy - at the cost of potentially going mad when they stop attacking.
30.quote: A bundle of bones and blood - and a soul-piercing demonic presence - is all that remains of the Flind's flail. It would make a decent mace with a particularly nasty bite.

30.name: The Blood of Lathander
30.icon: The Blood of Lathander Unfaded Icon.png
30.description: The Blood of Lathander is a legendary +3|notext=true Mace found through the Find the Blood of Lathander quest. It continuously sheds light, blinds nearby Fiends and Undead with its light, can heal its wielder, and allows the wielder to cast Sunbeam.

30.name: Xyanyde
30.description: Xyanyde is an uncommon +1 Mace that applies Faerie Fire on targets that the wielder misses, once per Short Rest.
30.quote: Cast deep in the Underdark by duergar slaves, the head of this mace is engraved with spiderwebs. It is ice-cold to the touch.

31.name: Corpsegrinder
31.description: Corpsegrinder is a rare +2 maul that deals additional Thunder|Thunder damage and grants its wielder the Grand Slam weapon action.
31.quote: Reliable and trustworthy, you could not hope for more respectable company than this maul whilst traversing the forlorn places of the world.

31.name: Doom Hammer
31.description: Doom Hammer is an uncommon maul that afflicts targets with Bone Chilled condition on each successful hit.
31.quote: Bringer of that which it is.

31.name: Foebreaker
31.description: Foebreaker is a very rare +2 maul that ignores Bludgeoning resistance of targets.
31.quote: As heavy and opposed to nonsense as the wearied hammer of a sentencing magistrate.

31.name: Hamarhraft
31.description: Hamarhraft is an uncommon maul that deals Thunder|Thunder damage in an area around the wielder when they land a Jump.
31.quote: The Dwarven grammar is garbled, but the weapon's name suggests something about the importance of first impressions.

31.name: Maul
31.description: Maul is a common variant of the Mauls family of weapons.
31.quote: Hammers like this are used in many dwarven competitions, testing who can throw them the farthest while enduring the most ale.

31.name: Maul +1
31.description: Maul +1 is an uncommon, lightly enchanted maul.
31.quote: A weapon of dwarven make: elegant, but strong enough to last several human lifetimes.

31.name: Rusty Maul
31.quote: Rust has eaten clean-through the heavy head of this maui.

32.name: Morningstar
32.quote:
●More of this morningstar's iron spikes are bent than not.


●A tuft of hair is caked to the base of one of this morningstar's jagged spiked.

32.name: Morningstar +1
32.quote: It's said that one warrior with a morningstar is worth seventeen with a sword - one for each of the weapon's spikes.

32.name: Ravengard's Scourger
32.description: Ravengard's Scourger is a rare +2 Morningstar that allows the wielder to cast Commander's Strike.
32.quote: Duke Ravengard's father was the sort of man who works with his hands, and communicates in grunts. In his heart his son vowed to do better. But when Wyll was born, Ravengard felt a strange gravity that drew him away from his son.

effects.name: Commander's Strike
effects.description: Direct an ally to strike a foe. The ally uses a reaction on their next turn to make a weapon attack. Once per Short Rest.

32.name: Rusty Morningstar
32.quote: The heavy head of this steel star is malefic with rust.

32.name: The Sacred Star
32.description: The Sacred Star is a very rare, +2 Morningstar that applies Radiating Orb on hit and possibly turns the target if it is Undead. It also grants the Dawnburst Strike weapon action.
32.quote: The power of this item lies in belief, though not in any god. This item believes that it's very good at hitting things, so it is. Belief is quite powerful when it comes to violence.

32.name: Twist of Fortune
32.description: Twist of Fortune is a rare +1 Morningstar with the unique weapon action, Blood Money. When the wielder rolls 2 or less with this weapon's damage die, they reroll and take the new result.
32.quote: They say rich folk are never truly happy; especially true when they're targeted with this morningstar.

33.name: Breaching Pikestaff
33.description: Breaching Pikestaff is a rare +2 Pike that deals an additional 1d4 Force|Force on each successful hit.
33.quote: Concussive energy thumps like a mighty heartbeat from this pike.

33.name: Broken Pike
33.quote: The pike's tip is battered and bent, fit for neither soldier nor scoundrel.

33.name: Magical Pike
33.quote: The base of this polearm's shaft is splintered, likely having borne the weight of a rider plucked from their mount.

33.name: Pike
33.quote: This pike's broad steel head has been repeatedly bent and hammered back into its original shape.

33.name: Pike +1
33.quote: The base of this polearm's shaft is splintered, likely having borne the weight of a rider plucked from their mount.

33.name: Returning Pike
33.description: Returning Pike is an uncommon +1 Pike that returns to the wielder automatically after being thrown.
33.quote: A 'Crazy Wilbur' is a technique invented by the dwarvish Ticklebeard Clan. It involves getting your larger enemies to swallow your weapon, then calling it back to you - as messily as possible.

33.name: Rusty Pike
33.quote: Truly the amount of rust accumulated on this pike is a lesson in how not to keep your weapons.

33.name: Unseen Menace
33.description: Unseen Menace is a rare +1 Pike increases critical hit chance and grants Advantage as long as the wielder keeps connecting hits.
33.quote: Yes, but what exactly is hitting you?

34.name: Bigboy's Chew Toy
34.description: Bigboy's Chew Toy is a rare +1 quarterstaff that grants its wielder the ability the ability to cast Enlarge on themselves once per Long Rest.
34.quote: Often mistaken for a relic of the wizard Bigby's creation, this staff was, ironically, made as a bite stick for Bigby's dog, Bigboy.

34.name: Cacophony
34.description: Cacophony is a rare +1 Quarterstaff that grants the wielder the Thunderous Smite spell.
34.quote: Carved in circles across the knob of the staff are different words for thunder. Gnomish, Sylvan, Elvish, Celestial, even the Primordial tongue - all of these and more fuse together to form the thunderword.

34.name: Caitiff Staff
34.description: Replenish 1 expended Warlock spell slots|recharge=Long Rest}}
34.quote: The texture of magic granted by a warlock's patron is largely dependent upon the patron themselves - for example, your standard eldritch patron's probably going to work some eyeball-mottled tentacles in there somewhere.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: name=Caitiff's Restoration|link=Caitiff's Restoration|icon=Caitiff's Restoration Icon|action type=action|description=Replenish 1 expended Warlock spell slots|recharge=Long Rest

effects.name: Caitiff Staff
effects.description: name=Caitiff's Restoration|link=Caitiff's Restoration|icon=Caitiff's Restoration Icon|action type=action|description=Replenish 1 expended Warlock spell slots|recharge=Long Rest

34.name: Corellon's Grace
34.description: Corellon's Grace is an uncommon Quarterstaff that increases the wielder's Saving Throws if the wielder is not wearing any armour. They also gain a bonus to Attack Rolls and Damage Rolls if attacking while unarmed.
34.quote: This light, flexible staff is of elven make, marked with mithral sigils that channel magic in the blink of an eye.

34.name: Creation's Echo
34.description: Creation's Echo is a rare Quarterstaff that grants the wielder resistance to Acid|Acid, Fire|Fire, Lightning|Lightning, Radiant|Radiant, or Necrotic|Necrotic damage after first dealing damage of that element.
34.quote: This staff pulses with energy, swiftly attuning itself to the beat of your heart.

34.name: Despair of Athkatla
34.description: Despair of Athkatla is a rare +2 Quarterstaff that enhances the wielder's spells.
34.quote: Touching the adornments, it's clear that Lorroakan's short temper has flowed into his staff. It flows into your brain in shades of burgundy and carmine, bright as the storm-lanterns of Lorroakan's homeland.

34.name: Druid Quarterstaff
34.description: The Druid Quarterstaff is a visually different variant of the regular Quarterstaff.  The only change is in appearance; all actual attributes are exactly the same.  Custom characters of the Druid class start the game with this weapon.
34.quote: Someone has carved twenty-seven small lines into the hard wood.

34.name: Gold Wyrmling Staff
34.description: Gold Wyrmling Staff is a rare quarterstaff that deals additional Fire|Fire damage with melee strikes and grants its wielder the Fire Bolt cantrip.
34.quote: The fire engulfing this staff seems to feed off thin air, never once burning the dark wood.

34.name: Harper Sacredstriker
34.description: Harper Sacredstriker is a rare +1 Quarterstaff that grants the wielder the Spiritual Weapon spell at level 6.
34.quote: This quarterstaff is as solid as the bond between each member of the Harpers - even working in anonymity, they do so with a common and righteous cause.

34.name: Hollow's Staff
34.description: Hollow's Staff is a rare +1 Quarterstaff that makes it difficult for enemies to resist the wielder's spells, and grants the wielder the Arms of Hadar spell.
34.quote: This staff was wielded by Thibault Hollow, a supremely talented necromancer notable for his overwhelming fear of zombies. Many was the time when his dread lair would echo with a high-pitched shriek when one of them surprised him in a corridor, or when he was taking a bath.

34.name: Incandescent Staff
34.description: Incandescent Staff is a very rare Quarterstaff that grants the wielder extra Spell Attack and resistance to Fire|Fire damage. It also grants the ability to cast the Fire Bolt and Fireball spells.
34.quote: Etchings course red-hot through the length of this staff, the script of primordial fire writ in flame.

effects.name: Incandescent Staff
effects.description:
Ranged Spell Attack +1
Resistance to Fire damage
Fire Bolt|level=0
Fireball|level=3|recharge=Long Rest

34.name: Markoheshkir
34.description: Markoheshkir is a legendary +2 quarterstaff that empowers the wielder's spells and can be tuned towards a certain element, granting extra spells and effects. It can also cast a spell for free, once per long rest.
34.quote: Kereska, draconic goddess of arcane knowledge, imbues many chromatic dragons with their magic. This includes their exquisite and terrible breath, which has wrenched giants from their tall thrones, and destroyed civilisations of smallfolk.

34.name: Melf's First Staff
34.description: The Melf's First Staff is a variant of the Quarterstaves that improve Spell Save DC and Spell Attack Rolls, and allows the wearer to cast Melf's Acid Arrow.
34.quote: This light, flexible staff is of elven make, marked with mithral sigils that channel magic in the blink of an eye.

34.name: Mourning Frost
34.description: Mourning Frost is a very rare, +1 Quarterstaff that enhances the wielder's Cold|Cold damaging spells with extra damage and the Chilled condition.
34.quote: The air around this staff crackles with a cold, frosty wind - a power that has been divided for too long, and is waiting to be released.

34.name: Nature's Snare
34.description: Nature's Snare is a variant of the Quarterstaves family of weapons that gives its wielder a chance to Ensnare non-plants and non-beasts on hit.
34.quote: Thread-like vines wriggle along this wooden staff.

34.name: Pale Oak
34.description: Pale Oak is a rare Quarterstaff that grants the Faithwarden's Vines spell and prevents the wielder from being Ensnared by vines.
34.quote: Infused with Silvanus' strength, these staves are gifted to Faithwardens who act in defence of nature.

34.name: Quarterstaff
34.quote: Someone has carved twenty-seven small lines into the hard wood.

34.name: Quarterstaff +1
34.quote: A polished wooden staff, embellished with knobs and steel for both function and design.

34.name: Quarterstaff +2
34.quote: Steel bands wrap around a wooden core, giving this staff extra momentum.

34.name: Rain Dancer
34.description: Rain Dancer is an uncommon Quarterstaff that grants the wielder the ability to cast Create Water, once per Short Rest.
34.quote: A pale staff inlaid with a droplet-shaped topaz. It is cool to the touch.

34.name: Ritual Staff
34.description:
The Ritual Staff is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the Quarterstaves family of weapons. It is a simple melee weapon that can be wielded in one hand, or with both hands for extra damage.

Beyond its unique appearance, this staff has the same stats of a normal Quarterstaff.
34.quote: Streaks of tendon and sinew cling to the animal skill lashed atop of this wooden staff.

34.name: Staff
34.quote: Gnarled, finger-like roots encase the gemstone at the top of this staff.

34.name: Staff of Arcane Blessing
34.description: Staff of Arcane Blessing is a uncommon Quarterstaff that grants the wielder the ability to cast Bless. In addition, all Bless spells cast by the wielder grant an additional +1d4 to spell attack rolls.
34.quote: Though dust has settled into every nook and cranny of this staff, it still emanates a soothing aura. Its previous owner cast it aside - forgotten because there was nobody to bless.

34.name: Staff of Cherished Necromancy
34.icon: Staff of Cherished Necromancy Unfaded Icon.png
34.description: Staff of Cherished Necromancy is a very rare +2 Quarterstaff that greatly enhances Necromancy spells and can use a dead creature's essence to cast a Necromancy spell without costing a spell slot.
34.quote: Unlike their father, Thibault, Cherish Hollow was not afraid of zombies. Cherish was afraid of sharks, liquorice, wallpaper, Netherese artifacts, hats (large), the outdoors, the indoors, hats (small), and milk pails. Zombies were a bloody picnic.

34.name: Staff of Crones
34.description: Staff of Crones is an uncommon Quarterstaff and Story Item that grants the wielder the ability to cast the spell Ray of Sickness, once per Short Rest.
34.quote: Live worms wriggle beneath the crumbling surface of this half-rotten staff. Merely touching it fills you with a wave of unbearable nausea and a strange longing, as if it's calling out for its like.

34.name: Staff of Interruption
34.description: Staff of Interruption is a rare quarterstaff that allows the wielder to cast Counterspell at Level 5.
34.quote: This staff hums with a disruptive arcane energy that drives nearby spellcasters to distraction

34.name: Staff of Spellpower
34.description: Staff of Spell Power is a very rare + 2 Quarterstaff that empowers the wielder's spells and can cast a spell without a spell slot, once per Long Rest.
34.quote: A near-perfect relic that is only blemished by the collected palm-sweat of various archmagi from across the Realms.

34.name: Staff of a Mumbling Wizard
34.description: Staff of a Mumbling Wizard is a Quarterstaff that allows the user to cast a variant of Fire Bolt that has a chance to cast Fireball instead.
34.quote: Because it was designed by a compulsive mumbler, this staff can't distinguish between its spells, and so can only cast - Fireball or Firebolt at random.

effects.name: Firebolt?
effects.description: Can cast the cantrip at will.

34.name: Staff of the Emperor
34.description: Staff of the Emperor is a rare +2 Quarterstaff that enhances the wielder's spells and possibly stuns enemy spellcasters.
34.quote: Ceremorphosis eradicates great swathes of the conciousness that came before... but not everything. Touching the staff, a fragment of the Emperor's memory slithers into your brain - you see sea waves foaming into spume, and feel the explorer's exultant joy. Then the image is gone, like so much silken night under a cut-shade sun.

34.name: Staff of the Moonmaiden
34.description: The Staff of the Moonmaiden is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the Quarterstaves family of weapons. It is a simple melee weapon that can be wielded in one hand, or with both hands for extra damage.
34.quote: This staff's blue inlays and moon-shaped ornamentation indicate its use among Selûne's clergy.

34.name: Staff of the Ram
34.description: The Staff of the Ram is a +2 Quarterstaff that can Stun and push back a target on a hit.
34.quote:
Fashioned by some unknown archmage - no identifying insignia is forthcoming.
The staff thrums with a slow, ferocious pulse that draws its concussive power from the spiral-horned creatures that gave the weapon its name

34.name: The Spellsparkler
34.description: The Spellsparkler is a rare Quarterstaff that allows the wielder to generate Lightning Charges upon dealing damage with spells.
34.quote: Yrre the Sparkstruck intended to give the Spellsparkler to Lenore a cleric of Mystra and old lover. But when the gnome returned to the cleric's tower, they found it empty - inhabited only by dust and abandoned experiments.

34.name: Twisted Oak Crook
34.quote: A staff engraved with a leafy motif, maples and oakleaf winding through a forest going through every stage of life, spring to bare-branched winter.

34.name: Woe
34.description: Woe is a very rare, +2 Quarterstaff wielded by Cazador Szarr. It grants better Spell Save DC and Spell Attack Rolls, access to the Blight spell, and healing when creatures fail Saving Throws by the caster's spells.
34.quote: The gentle tap-tap-tap of a staff on stone sparked terror for all in Cazador's palace. It signalled an approaching storm, and all they could do was shrink into the background and pray its wrath would not fall on them.

35.name: Duellist's Prerogative
35.description: Duellist's Prerogative is a legendary, +3 Rapier that grants the wielder a greater chance of critical hits, and an extra reaction provided their off-hand is empty. The wielder can also use a reaction to grant additional Necrotic|Necrotic damage on a hit.
35.quote: A blade gifted to Lora by her own mother, Lenore the Fleet. When challenged to duels, Lenore's opponents assumed she had received this nickname from some naval exploit. They found out how wrong they were when her blade blurred faster than the eye could follow.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: name=Challenge to Duel|link=Challenge to Duel|icon=Challenge to Duel Icon|action type=bonus|description=Challenge an enemy to attack only you, inflicting Bleeding on the target.|recharge=

effects.name: Duellist's Prerogative
effects.description: name=Challenge to Duel|link=Challenge to Duel|icon=Challenge to Duel Icon|action type=bonus|description=Challenge an enemy to attack only you, inflicting Bleeding on the target.|recharge=

35.name: Harmonic Dueller
35.description: Harmonic Dueller is a rare +1 Rapier that when activated, can grant all the wielder's melee attacks extra damage equal to their Charisma modifier.
35.quote: Unsheathed, the steel of this rapier shivers and thrums mellifluously in response to nearby surfaces - the motion brings to mind an actor struck with pre-show nerves.

35.name: Infernal Rapier
35.description: The Infernal Rapier is a very rare rapier and a possible reward for following Wyll's companion quest. It raises your Spell Save DC and, unlike other rapiers, uses your Spellcasting Modifier for Attack Rolls and Damage Rolls  instead of Strength or Dexterity.
35.quote: Imagine the soul as a blade. A good one, carefully looked after. A bad one suited for rusting in the rain. Flame-chewed and narrow, this blade is Wyll's soul summarised in steel.

35.name: Pactbound Rapier
35.description: A summoned weapon from Pact of the Blade. It uses the wielder's Spellcasting Ability Modifier, and its damage is magical.
35.quote: A summonable rapier granted by a warlock's patron. Its surface crackles with interdimensional energy.

35.name: Pelorsun Blade
35.description: Pelorsun Blade is a very rare +1 Rapier that automatically grants the wielder Advantage against Undead targets.
35.quote: After the blade had sliced Kas the Bloody-Handed's throat, it was chosen by Pelor, God of the Sun, to do righteous work against the undead.

35.name: Rapier
35.quote: A slender but deadly sword, favoured by Waterdhavian nobility.

35.name: Rapier +1
35.quote: A skillful smith decorated the wooden handle with a fine golden filigree.

35.name: Rapier +2
35.quote: The thin edge of this sword seems to blur and become nigh imperceptible with even the slightest movement.

35.name: Rupturing Blade
35.description: Rupturing Blade is an uncommon +1 Rapier that grants the Searing Blood weapon action that deals extra Fire|Fire damage on hit, but deals Slashing|Slashing damage to the wielder. In addition, it also may cause Bleeding and Burning.
35.quote: The point of the rapier is capable of splitting into heated barbs should the wielder device to prick themselves to activate them - sacrifice for reward.

35.name: Sword of Screams
35.description: Sword of Screams is an uncommon Rapier that deals an additional Psychic|1d4 Psychic damage.
35.quote: A blade of flawless craft. As it parts the air, you fancy you can hear a faint, whispering shriek...

36.name: Adamantine Scimitar
36.description: Adamantine Scimitar is a rare +1 Scimitar that automatically critical hits objects and ignores Resistance to Slashing|Slashing damage.
36.quote: Each cut of this blade shines with the wicked glint of adamantine -- a promise for a devastating blow.

36.name: Belm
36.description: Belm is a very rare +2 Scimitar that grants the Whirlwind Attack and Perfectly Balanced Strike weapon actions.
36.quote: Faded but still legible, the mark of a Kara-Turan forgemaster adorns the pommel of this exquisite sword. Light as a robin's wing, quick as a gnomish wit, this weapon has unseamed many foes - and will continue to, in the correct hands.

36.name: Djinni Scimitar
36.icon: Item WPN Djinni Scimitar A Unfaded Icon.png
36.description: Djinni Scimitar is the Scimitar used by a Djinni normally inaccessible to the player. It is a martial melee weapon wielded in one hand. As a finesse weapon, it can benefit from the wielder's Dexterity or Strength. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training.
36.quote: Contrary to popular belief, your standard djinni doesn't grant wishes, unless that wish is to have your nose lopped off.

36.name: Flame Blade (weapon)
36.description: Flame Blade is a magical, conjured variant of the Scimitars family of weapons. It is a martial melee weapon wielded in one hand.  It adds the user's spellcasting modifier to its attack roll; Wisdom if summoned as a Druid spell, and Charisma if summoned by a Mephistopheles Tiefling using their subrace trait.
36.quote: An ethereal scimitar made of living fire

36.name: Goblin Scimitar
36.description:
Goblin Scimitar is a common variant of the Scimitars family of weapons. It is a martial melee weapon wielded in one hand. As a finesse weapon, it can benefit from the wielder's Dexterity and not just their Strength. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training.

Beyond appearances, it has the same stats of a normal Scimitar.
36.quote: A cruel and crude blade forged en masse by goblin hordes.

36.name: Justiciar's Scimitar
36.description: Justiciar's Scimitar is a very rare Scimitar weapon that can blind an opponent if the wielder strikes with Advantage. It also grants the Shadowsoaked Blow weapon action.
36.quote: This light, curved blade is as unusual and unforgiving as the Darkness it strikes from.

36.name: Kurwin's Cauteriser
36.description: Kurwin's Cauteriser is an uncommon +1 Scimitar that deals extra Fire|Fire damage on hit, and possibly Burns the target as well.
36.quote: Mortician Kurwin was known to use his trusty Cauteriser on all sorts of interesting subjects. At first there were cadavers, then people who wouldn't be missed, and it was only after he targeted a well-liked tavern owner that he was ratted out to the law.

36.name: Rusty Scimitar
36.quote: Only an utter gibbon would consider swinging this in combat.

36.name: Salty Scimitar(rrr)
36.description: Salty Scimitar(rrr) is a rare +2 Scimitar that allows the wielder to cast Command once per Long Rest.
36.quote: Shiver me timbers, this be a devilishly nasty blade.

36.name: Scimitar
36.quote: This human-made scimitar falls far short of replicating the quality of the drow style it clearly imitates.

36.name: Scimitar (Akabi)
36.icon: Item WPN Djinni Scimitar A Unfaded Icon.png
36.description: Scimitar is a one-handed martial melee weapon. It is functionally identical to the common Scimitar, but is visually identical to the Djinni Scimitar.
36.quote: This human-made scimitar falls far short of replicating the quality of the drow style it clearly imitates.

36.name: Scimitar +1
36.quote: The phases of the moon are carved into the hilt of this scimitar, betraying a druid's careful hand.

36.name: Scimitar +2
36.quote: An arched electric-blue afterimage follows this blade's every move.

36.name: Speedy Reply
36.description: Speedy Reply is an uncommon Scimitar that grants the wielder 2 turns of Momentum whenever they hit an enemy.
36.quote: A heavy haft and wide blade belie the speed of this weapon. It parts the air as swiftly as any dueling sabre.

36.name: Sylvan Scimitar
36.description: Sylvan Scimitar is an uncommon +1 Scimitar that allows its wielder to use their Spellcasting Ability modifier instead of their Dexterity modifier to determine their Attack Roll bonus.
36.quote: Everything moves strangely in the Feywild, from rivers to behaviours. It's a mercurial place, where the magical and physical can pass permeably through one another.

36.name: Thorn Blade
36.description: Thorn Blade is a rare, lightly enchanted (+1) Scimitar that deals 1d4|Poison damage with melee weapons attacks while Concentrating and grants the ability to cast Ensnaring Strike (Melee).
36.quote: This Blade is sharp and slender as a serpent's fang - and just as likely to inflict a hideous sting.

37.name: Blightbringer
37.description: Blightbringer is a very rare +1 Shortbow that grants bonuses to attack and damage rolls against Gnomes and Dwarves, and Slows on a critical hit.
37.quote: Conducting a series of increasingly sick rituals - involving the ashes of a gnome and silkworms fed fat on the corpse of a dwarven cleric - the goblin shaman Kirruk Redrats created this deadly bow.

37.name: Bow of Awareness
37.description: Bow of Awareness is an uncommon +1 Shortbow that boosts the wielder's Initiative.
37.quote: This halfling bow requires a full draw for smaller folk, but serves as a quick off-hand for those of greater height.

37.name: Bow of the Banshee
37.description: Bow of the Banshee is a rare +1 shortbow that can Frighten targets on hit and grants bonuses to weapon damage and attack rolls against Frightened creatures.
37.quote: The impression of an elven face screams silently from the finely curved bow - the image becomes even more disturbing when the bowstring snaps forward on release, emitting a blood-curdling wail.

37.name: Darkfire Shortbow
37.description: Darkfire Shortbow is a rare +2 Shortbow that grants Resistance to Fire|Fire and Cold|Cold and grants the ability to cast Haste.
37.quote: This length of yew was polished in a lacquer made from the mingled, cooled, and refined breath of a gold and silver dragon.

effects.name: Darkfire Shortbow
effects.description:
Resistance to Fire damage.
Resistance to Cold damage.
Haste|level=3|recharge=Long Rest

37.name: Goblin Bow
37.description: A Goblin Bow is the favored ranged weapon used and created by Goblins. Besides appearances, it functions exactly like a normal Shortbow.
37.quote: Fashioned together from a rough-cut branch and stinking sinew.

37.name: Hunting Shortbow
37.description: Hunting Shortbow is an uncommon, +1 Shortbow that grants Advantage against Monstrosity type enemies and the ability to cast Hunter's Mark.
