37.quote: Supple and strong, this shortbow has been imbued with a ranger's solemn magic - running your fingers along the smooth ash, you can feel that solemnity like a ghost in the shaped wood.

37.name: Least Expected
37.description: Least Expected is a rare +2 Shortbow that increases Attack Rolls while obscured in shadow and also grants the Blinding Shot weapon action.
37.quote:
One of the relics of Deep Duerra's rebellious children. It was to the tremendous surprise of all that Ludmilla, the quiet, the weepy, the daughter most under her mother's thumb, took up this bow and fired.
The arrow flashed, and while Duerra and her blinded court wailed importantly, the children escaped into an uncertain, yet sweetly free, future.

37.name: Makeshift Bow
37.quote: Though Nothing more than a Flexible twig and string, this makeshift bow will do in a pinch.

37.name: Shortbow
37.quote: This small, agile bow bears a beautiful elven string, easy to draw but tough as steel.

37.name: Shortbow +1
37.quote: This halfling bow requires a full draw for smaller folk, but serves as a quick off-hand for those of greater height.

37.name: Vicious Shortbow
37.description: Vicious Shortbow is a rare Shortbow that deals 7 additional damage on a Critical Hit.
37.quote: Pliable yew and a hearty bowstring ensure this shortbow fires straight and true.

38.name: Ambusher
38.description: Ambusher is a rare +1 Shortsword that grants the wielder bonuses to Initiative and Advantage on Perception checks and deals extra Necrotic|Necrotic damage on creatures that haven't taken a turn yet.
38.quote: This blade is one of a few rare swords wielded by the Eucalyptus League, a group of fabulously wealthy courtesans who owned a great deal of Luskan's bazaars.

38.name: Assassin's Shortsword
38.description: Assassin's Shortsword is an uncommon Shortsword that grants the wielder Advantage on Stealth checks.
38.quote: Quiet is the air around this sword, and quiet are the steps of the one who wields it.

38.name: Chessa's Practice Sword
38.quote: A wooden sword coated in a thick layer of varnish. Well-loved, its handle is engraved with the name "Chessa".

38.name: Crimson Mischief
38.description: Crimson Mischief is a legendary Shortsword that, when wielded in the main hand, grants additional damage when attacking with Advantage and against targets with 50% or less of their hit points. When wielded in the off-hand, it instead allows the wielder to add their Ability Modifier to their damage.
38.quote: When she was a girl, she toyed with nastiness and sadism. Children often grow out of this; they get hobbies. For Orin, that taste for cruelty fermented, and in a way she did find hobbies. Ones that screamed.

38.name: Fleshrender
38.description: Fleshrender is a rare Shortsword that allows the wielder to make a diabolical strike, possibly stymying their target's ability to heal.
38.quote: The previous owner was going to call this sword Barney, but he got such a bollocking from his friends that he named it Fleshrender instead, and sulked for a whole tenday afterward.

38.name: Githyanki Shortsword
38.quote: Despite its engravings, this lightweight sword is perfectly balanced - a flawless killing implement.

38.name: Githyanki Shortsword (+1)
38.icon: Githyanki Shortsword Plus One Unfaded Icon.png
38.quote: Despite its engravings, this lightweight sword is perfectly balanced - a flawless killing implement.

38.name: Harper Blade
38.quote: A common and effective sword, carried by adventurers, thieves, and watchmen alike.

38.name: Kass' Practice Sword
38.quote: A wooden sword coated in a thick layer of varnish. Clumsy and covered in crude painted handprints like blood, the sword is engraved with the name 'Kass'.

38.name: Knife of the Undermountain King
38.image: Knife of the Undermountain King Faded.webp
38.icon: Knife of the Undermountain King Unfaded Icon.png
38.description: The Knife of the Undermountain King is a very rare +2 shortsword that increases the frequency of scoring Critical Hits and grants Advantage against enemies in the shadows.
38.quote: Snatched from the realm of the mad wizard Halaster Blackoak, this knife became a prized keepsake of a duergar king.

38.name: Practice Sword
38.description: The Practice Sword is a common Shortsword. It lacks the weapon actions of other shortswords, but is also the only shortsword that deals Bludgeoning damage.
38.quote: Though carefully coated in a thick layer of varnish, the edges of the wooden sword are already starting to chip away.

38.name: Render of Mind and Body
38.description: Render of Mind and Body is an uncommon +1 Shortsword that deals additional Psychic|Psychic damage whenever the attack is made at Advantage.
38.quote: The best offence is a struck cognisance.

38.name: Rusty Shortsword
38.quote: Leopard spots of rust mottle this sword.

38.name: Shadow Blade (weapon)
38.description: Shadow Blade is an uncommon Shortsword that grants the wielder advantage against Lightly or Heavily Obscured targets when using this blade. It also deals Psychic|2d8 Psychic damage instead of the usual 1d6.
38.quote: Umbral claws sweep through the long slender facets of the blade.

38.name: Shortsword
38.quote: A common and effective sword, carried by adventurers, thieves, and watchmen alike.

38.name: Shortsword +1
38.quote: A standard, lightweight sword, suitable for both thrusting and slashing techniques.

38.name: Shortsword +2
38.quote: A common and effective sword, carried by adventurers, thieves, and watchmen alike.

38.name: Shortsword of First Blood
38.description: The Shortsword of First Blood is an uncommon shortsword that deals more damage to enemies who haven't been injured yet.
38.quote: A golden blade, exquisitely made and astonishingly sharp.

38.name: Slicing Shortsword
38.description: The Slicing Shortsword is a rare +1 shortsword that inflicts Bleeding when the wielder attacks with advantage.
38.quote: So sharp you can cut yourself just talking about it.

38.name: Steelforged Sword
38.quote: Though the grip's leather is old and crusty, it shows no signs of wear, and not a single scratch mars the slender blade.

38.name: Sword of Clutching Umbra
38.description: Sword of Clutching Umbra is a rare, lightly enchanted (+1) Shortsword that grants the wielder a unique weapon action, Shadowsoaked Blow.
38.quote: Fingers of Shadow seem to beckon from the dark edge of the blade.

38.name: Sword of Life Stealing
38.description: The Sword of Life Stealing is a very rare +2 Shortsword that deals an extra 10 Necrotic|Necrotic damage on a critical hit, and heals the wielder for the same amount.
38.quote: Folded into the steel of this menacing weapon is an alloy of enchanted metal. It waits like a leech in thick swamp water, awaiting a victim to taste, awaiting a chance to restore your heartiness and inflict suffering on your foes.

38.name: The Baneful
38.icon: Githyanki Shortsword Plus One Unfaded Icon.png
38.description: The The Baneful is a rare +1 shortsword that only functions if it's Bound to an Eldritch Knight or is a Warlock's Pact weapon. It also applies the Bane condition on hit.
38.quote: The wizard Otiluke wrote about bound weapons and their propensity to coalesce with their wielder as the pair come together. He also wrote about their dangers, which are manifold, and their benefits, which make the danger worth it.

38.name: Trepan
38.quote: Though blood and age have rusted the mechanism, a good twist can still make the blades on this bloodletting device spin.

38.name: Trepan (+1)
38.description: Trepan is an uncommon +1 Shortsword that grants the weapon action Trephination to non player characters only.
38.quote: Though blood and age have rusted the mechanism, a good twist can still make the blades on this bloodletting device spin.

39.name: Rusty Sickle
39.image: Item WPN HUM Sickle A 0 Rusty A Faded.png
39.icon: Item WPN HUM Sickle A 0 Rusty A Unfaded Icon.png
39.quote: Not even useful in the herbalist trade.

39.name: Sickle
39.quote: A farming tool with a wicked edge, spilling blood and grain with equal ease.

39.name: Sickle (Redcap)
39.quote: A farming tool with a wicked edge, spilling blood and grain with equal ease.

39.name: Sickle of BOOOAL
39.quote: Infused with the inconceivable might of the formidable BOOOAL!

39.name: Sussur Sickle
39.description: The Sussur Sickle is a rare +1 Sickle that silences the targets it strikes, making it very effective against spellcasters.
39.quote: The sheen of sussur sap forged into this sickle glows blue, silencing every creature it cuts.

39.name: Wavemother's Sickle
39.description: Wavemother's Sickle is a rare, +2 Sickle that grants the wielder Advantage against targets with the Wet condition.
39.quote: The curve of this sickle evokes a pitiless crescent moon over turbulent seas.

41.name: False Spear of the Night
41.quote: While the handle is well made, the metal point is pitted with rust, and brittle as frozen underwear in the hands of a stone giant.

41.name: Infernal Spear
41.description: Infernal Spear is a rare +1 Spear that deals an extra 3 Poison|Poison damage and possibly Poisons the target on a hit.
41.quote: Precise infernal runes are woven into this weapon's filigree, implying a creator well-versed in hellish arcana.

41.name: Jagged Spear
41.description: Jagged Spear is an uncommon Spear that allows the wielder to possibly give their targets Disadvantage on Constitution Saving Throws.
41.quote: The blade of this spear is blackened and melted, leaving a cruel, rugged edge.

41.name: Lightning Jabber
41.description: Lightning Jabber is an uncommon +1 Spear that deals extra Lightning|Lightning damage when thrown, and also has a chance to Shock a target on hit.
41.quote: A makeshift spear fashioned from a giant crab's claw and the charged imagination of kuo-toa fishfolk.

41.name: Makeshift Spear
41.quote: Dirt and rust mar the edges of this spear, but it is deadly all the same.

41.name: Pitchfork
41.description:
Pitchfork is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the Spears family of weapons. It is a simple melee weapon that must be wielded in both hands as it lacks the Versatile quality. It also cannot be used as a proper Thrown weapon as it also lacks that trait.

Overall, it is a last-resort weapon among even the lowest quality of simple weapons.
41.quote: A farming tool crafted from mismatched branches, held together by fraying twine.

41.name: Rusty Spear
41.quote: While the handle is well made, the metal point is pitted with rust, and brittle as frozen underwear in the hands of a stone giant.

41.name: Sahuagin Spear
41.quote: Forged by dwarven hands, and prized by all warriors who wish to keep their foe at a distance.

41.name: Selûne's Spear of Night
41.icon: Selûne's Spear of Night Unfaded Icon.png
41.description: Selûne's Spear of Night is a legendary Spear that allows the wielder to cast Moonbeam and grants Darkvision as well as Advantage on Wisdom Saving Throws and Perception Checks.
41.quote: 'One of the goddess Selûne's titles, Moonmaiden, has often been debated among the ecclesiastical. Common symbology certainly rejects the assumption of virginity. More to the point, 'maiden' itself carries some dusty connotations. How about Lunar Lady? Keeps the alliteration, too' - Margaery Henderplum

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: name=Moonmote|link=Moonmote|icon=Moonmote Icon|description=Illuminate the area around you with wisps of moonish light that make movement difficult for enemies and bolster your allies' damage.|level=0|action type=action|recharge=Long Rest

effects.name: Selûne's Spear of Night
effects.description:
Moonbeam|level=3|recharge=Long Rest
name=Moonmote|link=Moonmote|icon=Moonmote Icon|description=Illuminate the area around you with wisps of moonish light that make movement difficult for enemies and bolster your allies' damage.|level=0|action type=action|recharge=Long Rest

41.name: Shar's Spear of Evening
41.icon: Selûne's Spear of Night Unfaded Icon.png
41.description: Shar's Spear of Evening is a legendary Spear that allows the wielder to gain Shar's Blessing and immunity to blindness.
41.quote: When visiting mortals in dreams, Shar's hair would curl and twist about her head like strands of inky midnight. If it tickled her nose, the goddess was careful not to show it.

41.name: Spear
41.quote: An aged spear, its steel head nicked by the blows of a dozen battles.

41.name: Spear +1
41.quote: Forged by dwarven hands, and prized by all warriors who wish to keep their foe at a distance.

41.name: Spear +2
41.description: Spear +2 is a rare, moderately enchanted spear.
41.quote: Even the ornamentation at the base of this spear's head is honed to a razor edge.

41.name: The Watcher's Guide
41.description: The Watcher's Guide is an uncommon Spear that increases the chance to hit a target after the wielder misses it.
41.quote: Time has dampened this spear's sheen, but the centre glows a faint blue. The magic it exudes feels old, terrible... and divine. The spear was given to its previous owner for his unerring loyalty - even after death.

41.name: Vision of the Absolute
41.icon: Vision of the Absolute Unfaded Icon.png
41.description: Vision of the Absolute is an uncommon Spear that possibly blinds targets and deals additional Piercing|Piercing damage against targets with multiple eyes.
41.quote: The tip of this spear strikes unerringly toward its target's eyes.

42.name: Nyrulna
42.description: Nyrulna is a legendary, +3 trident that can be thrown to create an explosion that deals Thunder|Thunder damage in an area. It grants additional movement speed and jump distance and will return to the wielder after being thrown.
42.quote: The forgemaster Lirrico designed this weapon for the champion of the wind goddess Akadi. A key component in the forging was his home city's wind, and for a year after the weapon was made, no wind blew there at all.

42.name: Pactbound Trident
42.description: A summoned weapon from Pact of the Blade. It uses the wielder's Spellcasting Ability Modifier, and its damage is magical.
42.quote: A summonable rapier granted by a warlock's patron. Its surface crackles with interdimensional energy.

42.name: Rusty Trident
42.quote: Rust pits each of this trident's prongs.

42.name: The Sparky Points
42.description: The Sparky Points is a rare Trident that allows the wielder to generate Lightning Charges upon dealing melee damage with this weapon.
42.quote: When Yrre the Sparkstruck was asked why they'd created a trident twice their size, they simply replied, 'The question is - why not create another weapon with spikes like lightning bolts?'

42.name: Trident
42.quote: It is said tridents were brought to the surface when Umberlee threw a Triton prince who scorned her onto Faerûn's shores.

42.name: Trident +1
42.quote: The brutal design of this weapon's trio of prongs forces pierced flesh apart.

42.name: Trident +2
42.quote: An elegant, vicious weapon designed to eviscerate flesh and organs.

42.name: Trident of the Waves
42.description: Trident of the Waves is a +1 Trident that creates a water surface around the target and applies the Wet condition to the target as well.
42.quote: Umberlee, the goddess of the sea, is deeply capricious, intelligent, and not nearly as wet around the edges as her domain might suggest. She often demands sacrificial tribute from sailors, such as their ships, their cargo, and, while she's at it, them.

43.name: Azer Warhammer
43.description: Hits with this weapon deal an additional 1d6|Fire damage.
43.quote: Flecks of volcanic glass gleam darkly from the head of this warhammer - obsidian eyes regarding the world with the narrow, spite-inflamed convictions of its azer wielder.

43.name: Ceremonial Warhammer
43.quote: Following tradition, this hammer's faces were forged with grooves that sealed in the blood of its first kill.

43.name: Charge-Bound Warhammer
43.description: Charge-Bound Warhammer is a rare, +1 Warhammer with +1 bonus to damage and Attack Rolls, and deals additional 1d6|Lightning damage as long as it is bound to an Eldritch Knight or Warlock Pact Weapon.
43.quote: Energy crackles in weird and wonderful patterns across your hand as you wield this bound weapon, as if your very veins were marbled like a cloud of blue-white lightning.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: This hammer's magical powers only function if it's Bound to an Eldritch Knight or is a Warlock's Pact Weapon. These effects are in addition to the weapon's +1 enchantment.

effects.name: Charge-Bound Warhammer
effects.description: This hammer's magical powers only function if it's Bound to an Eldritch Knight or is a Warlock's Pact Weapon. These effects are in addition to the weapon's +1 enchantment.

43.name: Clown Hammer
43.description: Clown Hammer is a rare +2 Warhammer that forces both the wielder and the target to make a Wisdom Saving Throw on a critical hit, or else fall down laughing.
43.quote: This hammer has a colourful history - it doesn't honk when you squeeze it, alas.

43.name: Dwarven Thrower
43.description: Dwarven Thrower is a very rare +2 Warhammer that returns to the wielder when thrown, and deals extra damage if the wielder is a Dwarf or the target is Large or greater.
43.quote: The first Dwarven Thrower was created unintentionally. The moment was transcribed in the annals of dwarfdom thusly: 'Ach, it doesn't work. Another design down the bloody drain. Now to... Does er... Does anyone else hear a short of humming whistle? Growing louder?'

43.name: Faithbreaker
43.description: Faithbreaker is an uncommon +1 Warhammer that grants the Absolute Power weapon action, which deals additional Force|Force damage and possibly pushes them back.
43.quote: A hand-like brand stamped into the leather handle obscures the notches that would normally signify a hobgoblin's rank.

43.name: Hammer of the Just
43.description: Hammer of the Just is a rare +2 Warhammer that deals additional Radian|Radiant damage, additional Bludgeoning|Bludgeoning damage to Fiends and Undead, and allows the wielder to cast Detect Thoughts.
43.quote: Tyr is often known as the Maimed God - a descriptor he shares with most victims of this heavy warhammer.

43.name: Intransigent Warhammer
43.description: Intransigent Warhammer is an uncommon Warhammer that knock nearby foes Prone after killing a hostile target or landing a Critical Hit.
43.quote: The elegant design of this hammer belies its brutal, crushing power. This weapon does not give ground.

43.name: Ketheric's Warhammer
43.quote: This hammer's weight is centred on enchanted obsidian at the base of the head. Some nights before bed, Ketheric would sneak a whey-faced glance at the hammer, and think about the stone, and wonder what unknown facet of his heart bore his weight.

43.name: Orphic Hammer
43.description: The Orphic Hammer is a legendary, plot-critical Warhammer with the power to shatter infernal bonds. It also grants the wielder Advantage on saving throws vs spells.
43.quote: Every contract a devil makes has some form of insurance - this one is cast in infernal iron and was forged in deep, ruinous hellfire.

43.name: Pactbound Warhammer
43.description: A summoned weapon from Pact of the Blade. It uses the wielder's Spellcasting Ability Modifier, and its damage is magical.
43.quote: A summonable warhammer granted by a warlock's patron. Its surface crackles with interdimensional energy.

43.name: Warhammer
43.quote: This hammer's noticeable lack of upkeep hardly matters, given its heft.

43.name: Warhammer +1
43.quote: Following tradition, this hammer's faces were forged with grooves that sealed in the blood of its first kill.

43.name: Warhammer +2
43.quote: The segmented design of this gnome-forged hammer borrows elements of dragonborn weaponry.

44.name: Deep Delver
44.description: Deep Delver is an uncommon War Pick that inflicts the Shattered condition on hit.
44.quote: Countless hands have smoothened the haft and sharpened the blade. This is an ancestral weapon - perhaps dating back to the ancient digs that sundered the duergar from their dwarf-kin.

44.name: Hoppy
44.description: Hoppy is an uncommon War Pick that allows the wielder to use Revitalising Strike.
44.quote: Not the most elegant of weapons, the warpick's cumbersome weight certainly allows it to be deadly in combat, when wielded by a strong arm. Inexplicably, this one has a small rabbit carved into the handle.

44.name: Pickaxe
44.description: War Pick is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the War Picks family of weapons. It is a martial melee weapon wielded in two-handed, making it unique among other War Picks.
44.quote: A plain tool, covered almost entirely in coppery rust.

44.name: War Pick
44.quote: A pickaxe modified to pierce flesh and armour rather than stone.

44.name: War Pick +1
44.quote: When swung, the arc of this weapon perfectly matches the curve of its beak-like pick.
